0.title: No truth to this: Hrithik on report claiming he's moving in with Saba in ₹100-cr house
0.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to refute a report claiming that he will be moving into a new ₹100-crore apartment with his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad. Hrithik tweeted, "There is no truth to this. As a public figure, I understand I'll be under the lens of curiosity, but it's best if we keep misinformation away".

1.title: 3 including director, HR of NGO Chilume arrested for voter data theft
1.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested three people, including one of the founder-directors and human resource (HR) official of the NGO Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust, in connection with their investigation into alleged voter data theft in the city. The software developer, who allegedly created the 'Digital Sameeksha' app, was also reportedly taken into custody.

2.title: 3 transgenders selected as government school teachers in Karnataka
2.article_body: The Karnataka government has recruited three transgender teachers for state-run primary schools. "1% reservation was given in teacher recruitment for gender minorities. For the first time, three gender minorities have been selected," Education Minister BC Nagesh said. According to reports, a total of ten transgender people took the exam, out of which three were shortlisted.

3.title: Passenger was carrying explosives, had fake Aadhaar: Police on Mangaluru blast
3.article_body: In Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case, Karnataka Police has named the passenger as the prime suspect. DGP Praveen Sood said he was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card. "Since he...got 40% burns, we have to wait before we can interrogate him," Sood added. Meanwhile, Karnataka minister Araga Jnanendra said the terror link will be revealed soon.

4.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma visit temple in Uttarakhand; pic goes viral
4.article_body: Virat Kolhi and Anushka Sharma recently visited Nainital, Uttarakhand for a break with their one-year-old daughter Vamika. Anushka and Virat also sought blessings at the Neem Karoli Baba Ashram in Kainchi Dham. They were clicked with a few local fans in Nainital and the photos have gone viral on social media.

5.title: I don't see any reason for it: Donald Trump on whether he'll return to Twitter
5.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said, "I don't see any reason for it," when asked whether he planned to return to Twitter. He said he sees a "lot of problems" at Twitter and he will be staying on his own social media platform Truth Social. The comments came hours before Elon Musk reinstated Trump's Twitter account following a public poll.

6.title: Air India in talks with Boeing, Airbus to order new aircraft
6.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson has said the airline is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft. It aims to increase its market share to 30% on both domestic and international routes over the next five years. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes, expanding its fleet by more than 25%.

7.title: 78 foreign nationals deported for illegal stay in Pune in last 4 years
7.article_body: As many as 78 foreign nationals have been deported for illegal stay in Pune in last four years, according to the data provided by the Pune City Police. Some of them engaged in various unauthorised activities, the officials stated. According to the data, 42 foreign nationals were deported in 2019, 25 in 2020, three in 2021 and eight in 2022.

8.title: China reports 1st COVID-19 death in almost 6 months amid rising cases
8.article_body:
China on Sunday reported its first new death from COVID-19 in almost six months. The death of an 87-year-old Beijing man was the first reported by the National Health Commission since May 26. 
Due to rising cases in the country, lockdowns and strict restrictions have been put in place. On Saturday, China reported 24,263 new cases.

9.title: Counting of votes in Nepal elections to begin at 9 pm today
9.article_body: Nepal's Chief Election Commissioner Dinesh Kumar Thapaliya said the votes polled to elect a new Parliament and provincial Assemblies will be counted from 9 pm on Sunday. The voting will close at 5 pm and the ballot boxes would be collected by 7 pm. Collecting ballot boxes from mountainous districts would take time hence its counting will begin on Monday.

10.title: Twitter working on restoring Trump's previous followers: Elon Musk
10.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking for former President Donald Trump's previous followers to be restored, said, "Twitter engineering is working on it." The platform unbanned Trump's account on Sunday after Musk's poll saw 51.8% of over 15 million votes in favour of reinstatement. Trump's account reappeared on Twitter minutes after the poll ended.

11.title: Air India Mumbai-Calicut flight with 114 passengers delayed by 3 hrs
11.article_body: A Calicut-bound Air India flight from the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai was delayed by more than three hours on Sunday due to a technical issue, the airline said. There were 114 passengers on the flight. The aircraft came back at 6:25 am after push back at 6:13 am and finally departed at 9:50 am.

12.title: BJP’s criticism shows Bharat Jodo Yatra is a success: Cong
12.article_body: The Congress on Saturday said that criticism by the BJP of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra and Rahul Gandhi is a clear indication of the yatra’s success.“The BJP targeting the Bharat Jodo Yatra is a clear indication…it’s troubling them very much,” Congress leader KC Venugopal said. “Why should we be worried, let them criticise,” he added.

13.title: AAP protests against potholes in B'luru, demands action against officials
13.article_body: AAP leaders protested in Bengaluru over the issue of potholes and asked the government to take action against officials. They demanded that the civic body make a promise to the citizens to fix all the potholes within a week. The party also demanded a compensation of ₹25 lakh for each family that lost loved ones in accidents due to potholes.

14.title: I stopped getting roles when I got married, it caused me depression: Deepti Naval
14.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval has said she went through depression when she stopped getting offers after her marriage. She said, "It was as if my talent had been completely washed out...There were several years when I had no work. That was one of the things that caused me depression." Deepti married Prakash Jha in 1985, however, they got divorced in 2002.

15.title: Who are the past winners of FIFA World Cup?
15.article_body: Uruguay had won the first-ever FIFA World Cup in 1930. Brazil have won FIFA World Cup for the most number of times (five). The last five FIFA World Cups have been won by five different teams (France, Germany, Spain, Italy and Brazil). The 1958 final, which Brazil won 5-2 against Sweden, was the highest-scoring final in FIFA World Cup history.

16.title: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria booked for releasing '32 bore' song promoting gun culture
16.article_body: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria, producer Satta DK and owners of Love Music company have been booked in Ludhiana for releasing the song '32 bore' after the Punjab government banned songs glorifying weapons. Police said that the song was being shared on social media after its release on YouTube, and it glorifies weapons in the video as well as its lyrics.

17.title: Don't buy TV, fridge, car, hold on to your money: Bezos as he warns of recession
17.article_body: Amazon Founder and world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos urged people to consider not making large purchases as the "economy does not look good right now". In a recent interview, Bezos warned of a recession and asked American families to postpone purchase of items like big-screen TV, automobile, and refrigerator. "Hold onto your money, and see what transpires," the entrepreneur added.

18.title: Women, kids worked as whistleblowers for Swachh Bharat: Jal Shakti Minister
18.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that women and children worked like whistleblowers for the 'Swachh Bharat Mission'. "People's participation was most important for us and India owes its success to people who adopted this campaign relentlessly. It was women and children of the country, especially from small towns and villages, who became real change makers," Shekhawat said.

19.title: Flipkart denies posting job vacancy copied from Aus firm, says 'Our team didn't post this'
19.article_body: A job opening posted by Flipkart on LinkedIn appeared to have been copied from a similar vacancy shared by an Australian software company Atlassian. Replying to a LinkedIn user's post about the 'Head of Design' job opening, Flipkart said that no such role exists in the company and that no one from their recruitment team was involved in posting this.

20.title: Pregnant dog beaten to death, body dragged across field in Delhi; FIR filed
20.article_body: A pregnant dog was tortured to death by more than 25 students and staff members suspected to be of Don Bosco Technical Institute in South East Delhi, officials said. The video of the incident went viral in which the dog was seen being dragged across the field in the college compound. The New Friends Colony Police registered an FIR.

21.title: Electric meter tampering cases on rise in Pune
21.article_body: The number of meter tampering activities are on rise in Pune as Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) reported 5,719 cases of electricity theft and 1,591 cases of unauthorised use of electricity in the last 6 months. The electricity theft amounted to ₹16.07 crore while unauthorised use of electricity worth ₹6.43 crore was reported during this period.

22.title: Tabassum's last wish was to not inform about her death for at least 2 days: Govil
22.article_body: Tabassum's brother-in-law and actor Arun Govil shared that the veteran actress' last wish was to "not inform anyone about her demise for at least two days". "Her last rites were performed yesterday. She had a peaceful last journey," he shared. He informed that Tabassum, who passed away on Friday due to cardiac arrest, also suffered from some gastrointestinal problems.

23.title: Physiotherapists association condemns Sisodia's claim on Jain's massage video in jail
23.article_body: The Indian Association of Physiotherapists has refuted Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's claim of "physiotherapy treatment" on the leaked video of Satyendar Jain getting a massage in Tihar Jail. "IAP strongly condemns the statement of the minister degrading physiotherapy...Shows the level of education and knowledge to them about our noble profession," the association said.

24.title: Bihar woman alleges 'love jihad', says 'Family forcing her to eat beef'
24.article_body: A Hindu woman, Julie, in Bihar has accused her husband of 'love jihad' and claimed that the man was pressuring her to convert to Islam. "One day I came to know...that he is Tauquir, not Raj Singh...His entire family…[is] forcing me to eat beef...He is threatening that he will kill my entire family," said Julie.

25.title: Thank you for coming into my life: Shehnaaz remembers Sidharth Shukla
25.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, who won an award at a recently held award function, remembered late actor Sidharth Shukla and thanked him for coming into her life. "You have invested so much in me that today I've reached here," she said in Hindi. The video of her speech at the award show went viral on social media platforms.

26.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against New Zealand
26.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. India's playing XI includes Ishan Kishan, Rishabh Pant, Shreyas Iyer, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar and Yuzvendra Chahal. The first T20I was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

27.title: India reports 492 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,489
27.article_body: India reported 492 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 556 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 6,489. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,574, according to the ministry.

28.title: Woman caught with cocaine worth ₹3.6 crore hidden in wheelchair tyres in US
28.article_body: A woman was arrested at JFK Airport in New York after she allegedly tried to smuggle 28 pounds of cocaine with an estimated value of $450,000 (₹3.6 crore) in the tyres of her wheelchair. Customs officials stopped the woman after they noticed the wheels of her wheelchair weren't spinning properly. A Dominican national, she now faces federal narcotics smuggling charges.

29.title: Musk made it clear he'll be calling the shots: Twitter ex-executive on why he quit
29.article_body: Twitter's former Head of Safety and Trust Yoel Roth penned an article explaining reasons for his departure. He wrote that he ultimately left Twitter because Elon Musk "made clear that at the end of the day, he'll be the one calling the shots". "A Twitter whose policies are defined by edict has little need for...trust and safety function," he added.

30.title: Those who defame Gujarat should not find place in state: PM Modi
30.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally in Gujarat’s Valsad district on Saturday, appealed to people to be wary of those who defame Gujarat and said they should not find a place in the state. "We can never accept those who try to take Gujarat in reverse gear...They are trying to defame Gujarat and Gujaratis," PM Modi added.

31.title: One of India's most-wanted terrorist Rinda died of drug overdose in Pak: Reports
31.article_body: Harvinder Singh Sandhu alias Rinda, a most-wanted terrorist carrying a reward of ₹10 lakh, has reportedly died at a hospital in Lahore. Rinda, who was under the protection of Pakistan's ISI, was reportedly being treated for a kidney ailment triggered by drug overdose. Rinda was the mastermind behind the RPG attack on Punjab Police's Intelligence headquarters at Mohali this year.

32.title: Car catches fire in parking lot of Hyderabad Airport, driver jumps out
32.article_body: A fire broke out in a car when it reached the parking area of Hyderabad Airport, reports said. The car caught fire when the driver was about to park it in the parking area of the airport. The driver reportedly jumped out of car when he realised it was on fire. Some other vehicles near the car also caught fire.

33.title: Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom: Sunak in Ukraine
33.article_body: On his maiden visit to Ukraine after assuming office, UK PM Rishi Sunak said Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom. "We are with you all the way Volodymyr Zelenskyy," he tweeted, expressing UK's support for Ukraine in war against Russia. Thanking Sunak, Zelenskyy tweeted, "With friends like you by our side, we are confident in our victory."

34.title: PM Modi visits Somnath Temple on trip to Gujarat, pics surface
34.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday visited the Somnath Temple in Gujarat and offered prayers to the Aadi Jyotirling. Notably, PM Modi is also the Chairman of the temple's trust. He is scheduled to visit the Saurashtra region and will address rallies in  Veraval, Dhoraji, Amreli and Botad. On Monday, he will address rallies in Surendranagar, Bharuch and Navsari.

35.title: We are underestimating Elon Musk's genius: Harsh Goenka
35.article_body: Businessman Harsh Goenka said people are "underestimating the genius of Elon Musk". Stating that there must be "a method to his madness", Goenka noted that Musk was ahead of his time with his other companies like Tesla, SpaceX and The Boring Company. "He surely has a game plan with Twitter...Let's give him time before we predict its death," Goenka tweeted.

36.title: Cong against development: Vijay Rupani on Patkar joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
36.article_body: After activist Medha Patkar joined 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra, former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that Patkar's participation in the Congress' 'padayatra' shows that the party is against development. "Medha Patkar was the person who opposed [the] Narmada dam project. She protested over it and created obstacles in the state's development," said Rupani.

37.title: Athiya-KL Rahul's wedding will happen very soon: Suniel Shetty
37.article_body: Suniel Shetty has confirmed his daughter and actress Athiya Shetty will soon marry cricketer KL Rahul. At the Dharavi Bank launch event, reporters asked Suniel Shetty when Athiya Shetty would be getting married to KL Rahul, to which the actor answered, "Jaldi hogi". The couple has reportedly been in relationship for the past three years.

38.title: Cisco to lay off over 4,000 employees in a 'rebalancing' move: Report
38.article_body: Cisco is reportedly laying off over 4,000 employees, or about 5% of its workforce. According to a report, while Cisco CEO termed it as "rightsizing certain businesses", CFO Scott Herren said, "Don't think of this as a headcount action that is motivated by cost savings. This really is a rebalancing." Recently, Twitter, Meta and Amazon had announced job cuts.

39.title: John Abraham to star in Abhishek Sharma's science-fiction film Parlok
39.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma has confirmed that he is teaming up with John Abraham for his upcoming film, titled 'Parlok', which will be a "science-fiction film". "It's a fantastic story we both want to tell...this is going to be a new world for me to explore as a director," Sharma said, adding that John will also produce the film.

40.title: Bihar CM to be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil job promise: Prashant Kishor
40.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil his promise of providing "10 lakh government jobs" to the youth of Bihar in the coming days. "The CM, during his Independence Day speech...had promised that the grand alliance government aimed at providing jobs to 10 lakh people in government sector," Kishor added.

41.title: B'luru Police issues advisory banning heavy vehicles near Hebbal flyover
41.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police announced a ban on heavy vehicles between the Sadahalli toll gate and the Hebbal junction to facilitate ease of commute between the Bengaluru International Airport and the city during peak hours. The ban will be effective between 8.30 am and 10.30 am every day, according to the order issued by new Bengaluru Traffic Special Commissioner.

42.title: Nepal to sell 5 Chinese planes over breakdowns, lack of pilots: Report
42.article_body: State-owned Nepal Airlines has decided to sell five Chinese planes due to breakdowns and a lack of pilots, a report said. In September, the three 17-seater and two 56-seater aircraft were put for lease for bidders. The deadline of October 31 was extended to November 16 but Nepal Airlines didn't get a single bid even after the extension.

43.title: 7 people try getting on 2-wheeler; Delhi police share video, say 'Only for 2'
43.article_body: Delhi Police shared a video of seven people trying to get on one two-wheeler. "Lest the world of happiness gets ruined...Two-wheelers are only...for two people," police wrote. In the video, a woman can be seen making a child sit on a bike while two people are already on it. Two children and two women can be seen waiting.

44.title: Staff leaving Twitter after Musk's mail share pics of laptops with blue bird stickers
44.article_body: Several employees who chose to quit after Elon Musk's mail about the company's "hardcore culture", tweeted photos of their laptops with blue bird stickers and memorabilia. A former employee also tweeted, "I may be exceptional but...I’m just not hardcore." In the email, Musk had asked staff to commit to a "new Twitter" or leave with three months of severance pay.

45.title: Madras HC prevents 12,000 websites from streaming FIFA WC illegally
45.article_body: The Madras High Court on Friday restrained over 12,000 websites from streaming the FIFA World Cup 2022 illegally. Justice M Sundar granted the injunction while passing interim orders on an application arising out of a civil suit filed by Viacom 18. Viacom 18 said it has transmission rights for Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

46.title: Act of terror, not accidental: K'taka DGP on autorickshaw blast in Mangaluru
46.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood said on Sunday that the explosion in an autorickshaw in Mangaluru was not accidental but an act of terror. The intention was to cause serious damage, he added. "Karnataka State Police is probing deep into it along with central agencies," Sood tweeted. The autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded.

47.title: Retired professor cheated of ₹20 lakh by cyber fraudsters in Pune
47.article_body: A 74-year-old retired professor was cheated of ₹20 lakh in an online fraud in Pune. "On the pretext of helping the senior citizen to complete her KYC update, the fraudster tricked the complainant into giving her debit card details, including the CVV number," said a police officer. The accused also hacked her mobile phone by making her download an application.

48.title: Waymo gets permit to offer driverless test rides in California
48.article_body: Alphabet's self-driving vehicles unit Waymo has received California Public Utilities Commission's permit to participate in a driverless pilot programme. Under the programme, passengers will be able to ride in test autonomous vehicles operating without a driver. With this permit, Waymo may offer driverless passenger service throughout San Francisco and portions of Palo Alto, among other cities.

49.title: Split coaching after 2023 ODI WC has high plausibility: Dinesh Karthik
49.article_body: With Ravi Shastri criticising India head coach Rahul Dravid for taking a break for the New Zealand tour, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said that "split coaching" could be the way forward, considering the amount of cricket being played. "It's something which India needs to look into after the 2023 ODI World Cup when the contract is up for renewal," stated Karthik.

50.title: Son of retired constable cheats people in Thane wearing fake uniform, arrested
50.article_body: A 41-year-old man was arrested in Thane for wearing fake police officer's uniform and cheating people. The accused, son of a retired police constable, wanted to become a police officer but failed to do so. He would stop cars and extort money for any violations. He also cheated a woman who fell in love with him believing his fake identity.

51.title: Ballon d'Or winner Karim Benzema ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup
51.article_body: France striker Karim Benzema, who won the Ballon d'Or award this year, has been ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar after tearing a muscle in his left thigh during training on Saturday. It will now be the first time since 1978 that the reigning Ballon d'Or winner will not feature in the World Cup.

52.title: Such crimes committed due to access to material on internet: Bombay HC CJ on Shraddha case
52.article_body: Referring to Mumbai woman Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, Bombay High Court Chief Justice Dipankar Datta said, "All these crimes are being committed because there is so much access to the material on the internet." He added, "The Indian Telecommunication bill is there and we require certain robust legislation to tackle all the situations."

53.title: Couldn't prevent my son from committing suicide, felt guilty: Kabir Bedi
53.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi said he feels guilty that he couldn't prevent his son Siddharth Bedi "from committing suicide". Siddharth took his own life in 1997, at the age of 25, after being diagnosed with schizophrenia. Kabir also spoke about the time when he went through financial disasters and suffered great losses due to bad investments.

54.title: Judges at grassroots reluctant to grant bail due to fear of being targeted: CJI
54.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud on Saturday said judges at the grassroots are reluctant to grant bail due to the sense of fear of being targeted for granting bail in heinous cases. "The higher judiciary is flooded with bail applications due to reluctance at grassroots to grant bail," CJI Chandrachud said at a felicitation event organised by the Bar Council of India.

55.title: Dismantling of Carnac Bridge starts in Mumbai, Central Railway shares video
55.article_body: The dismantling of Carnac Bridge has started in Mumbai. The Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the process. "Dawn of the day. Dismantling in progress," the Central Railway wrote. A Central Railway official said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces using gas cutters and gas cylinders in a 27-hour operation.

56.title: Don't be swayed by what Musk's selling, it doesn't fit your type: Ashneer to founders
56.article_body: Addressing the mass layoffs taking place globally, 'Shark Tank India' investor Ashneer Grover urged startup founders not to get "swayed by what Elon Musk is selling as couture" as "it does not fit your body type". He suggested that founders should reduce salaries by 25% rather than conducting mass layoffs. "It's a better solution as rehiring will be...costly," Grover added.

57.title: People with no contribution to country shouldn't question Savarkar: Assam CM
57.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against VD Savarkar and said that people who have made no contribution to the country should not question freedom fighters. "Savarkar spent many years in jail…It is a sin to question Savarkar's contribution. Rahul Gandhi should not [commit] this sin," said Sarma.

58.title: Court says Mumbai driver applied brakes due to speed breaker in 9-yr-old case
58.article_body: A magistrate court has acquitted an auto driver in a nine-year-old rash driving case, alleging that he applied brakes to avert an accident after he saw an unmarked speed breaker 10 feet away. A mother and son travelling in his auto had sustained injuries when it skid and fell on its side. A complaint had been registered.

59.title: 2 arrested for posing as GST officials, cheat people of ₹28 cr in Hyd
59.article_body: The Cyberabad Special Operations Team arrested two persons, posing as GST officials, for allegedly cheating 18 persons to the tune of ₹28 crore. They approached people, saying they could help them get gold and other expensive items seized by the customs department at lower prices. DCP (Balanagar), G Sandeep, said they would collect huge amounts from the victims and escape.

60.title: It wasn't poor bowling from India, just a chasable target: Hales on T20 WC semis
60.article_body: England batter Alex Hales, on being asked about their 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final match, said  India were "30 runs short" in the match. "Chasing a total of 160 or 170 is a little bit easy at Adelaide...I don't necessarily think it was poor bowling from India," added Hales. England chased down India's 169-run target without losing a single wicket.

61.title: Pay disparity exists because of 'insecurity of a man': Jaya Bachchan
61.article_body: Actress-politician Jaya Bachchan said that the pay disparity, which exists in every field, "is an outcome" of men's "insecurity". "He's (man is) insecure, which is why he feels it's easier to put a woman down...in every way," she mentioned. Shweta Bachchan said the issue (of pay parity) needs to be addressed as women are "making an equal impact as men".

62.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face 12-hr water cut tomorrow
62.article_body: Parts of South Bengaluru will be facing water supply disruptions tomorrow (November 21) from 6 am to 6 pm. The water supply will be stopped to carry out work on shifting supply lines of various diameters near Metro construction sites laid by BWSSB (Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board) from KR Puram to Silk Board along the Outer Ring Road.

63.title: China urging military veterans to work at iPhone factory to boost production: Reports
63.article_body: Chinese government officials are reportedly urging retired military staff to help boost production at the Apple iPhone maker Foxconn’s factory in Zhengzhou as its production got hit by COVID-19-related restrictions. A Veteran Affairs Bureau of the People's Liberation Army in the plant's province said veterans were always under Communist Party's command and should "show up where there's a need".

64.title: BJP's top leaders to hold 14 roadshows for MCD polls in Delhi today
64.article_body: Ahead of MCD polls in Delhi, BJP has planned 14 roadshows led by several top leaders today to woo voters. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, BJP chief JP Nadda, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, Haryana CM ML Khattar, Union MoS Jitendra Singh and MoS Meenakashi Lekhi are among the ones enlisted for the campaign.

65.title: Bengal man barks at officer after ration card printed with surname 'Kutta', video goes viral
65.article_body: A man named Srikanti Kumar Dutta in West Bengal's Bankura district behaved like a dog by 'barking' at a local block development officer after his surname on the ration card was misspelt as 'Kutta' (dog) instead of 'Dutta'. A video of the incident has gone viral. Dutta said his name was misprinted thrice and he was mentally disturbed by this.

66.title: 45-yr-old Pune woman cycles 3,955 km from Koteshwar to Kibithoo in 13 days
66.article_body: A Pune-based 45-year-old woman, Preeti Maske, covered a distance of 3,955 km from the Indo-Pak border at Koteshwar to reach Kibithoo in Arunachal Pradesh on the Indo-Tibetan border on a cycle in 13 days, 19 hours and 12 minutes. Reports said that she completed her journey at 12:19 am on November 15. The 3,955 km long trip covered seven states.

67.title: Mumbai local train services hit due to 27-hr mega block for bridge demolition
67.article_body: Local train services in Mumbai will remain affected as the Central Railway (CR) has announced a 27-hour mega block from 11 pm on November 19 to 2 am on November 21 for the demolition work of British-era Carnac Bridge. The block will be operated for 17 hours on the Main line and for 21 hours on the Harbour line.

68.title: Biden's granddaughter Naomi marries Peter Neal at White House; pics surface
68.article_body: US President Joe Biden's granddaughter Naomi Biden and Peter Neal were married in a private ceremony at the White House on Saturday. The event marked the 19th wedding in the 200-plus years of White House history. "It has been a joy to watch Naomi grow...[and] carve out such an incredible life for herself," Biden and first lady Jill said.

69.title: Donald Trump's account reappears on Twitter 22 months after it was banned
69.article_body: Former President Donald Trump's Twitter account was visible again on Sunday, shortly after Elon Musk announced he would be reinstated on the platform. The @realDonaldTrump account, including its previous tweets, reappeared 22 months after it was permanently suspended due to risk of further incitement of violence. "The people have spoken," wrote Musk on the results of a personal Twitter poll.

70.title: 3 Humboldt penguins born in Byculla zoo in 7 months named Flash, Bingo, Alexa
70.article_body: Three Humboldt penguins who were born in Mumbai's Byculla Zoo in last seven months have been named Flash, Bingo and Alexa. Male chicks, Flash and Bingo, were born on April 2 and 26 respectively. Female chick, Alexa, was born on August 9. Penguins Donald and Daisy gave birth to Flash and Alexa, while Bingo was born to Molt and Flipper.

71.title: SpaceX to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander on Nov 28
71.article_body: SpaceX is scheduled to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander, part of the HAKUTO-R lunar exploration program, on November 28. Following landing, Hakuto-R's M1 will deploy a small United Arab Emirates rover, called Rashid. The firm has chosen the Atlas Crater at Mare Frigoris to the far north of the Moon as its primary landing site.

72.title: Elon Musk considers firing more Twitter employees: Report
72.article_body: Elon Musk is reportedly considering firing more Twitter employees as soon as Monday, days after hundreds of employees resigned by declining to accept the billionaire's ultimatum of an "extremely hardcore" culture. The new round of layoffs will likely target the sales and partnerships teams, Bloomberg reported. Musk has fired two executives who refused to fire more employees, the report said.

73.title: Amazon-owned Wickr Me messaging app to shut down next year
73.article_body: Amazon's AWS-owned Wickr Me messaging app will shut down on December 31, 2023. Wickr said the app will stop accepting new user registrations after December 31, 2022, before shutting down permanently next year. Earlier this year, a report suggested that Wickr Me had become "a go-to destination for people to exchange images of child sexual abuse".

74.title: Donald Trump will be reinstated on Twitter, confirms Elon Musk
74.article_body: Elon Musk confirmed on Sunday morning that former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account will be reinstated. The decision was announced after 51.8% of over 15 million users voted in favour of unbanning Trump's account on a poll held by Musk. "The people have spoken," Musk wrote. Trump's Twitter account was suspended after last year's attack on the US Capitol.

75.title: Messi-led Argentina staying at Qatar University instead of hotel due to barbecue: Reports
75.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina are staying at Qatar University instead of 5-star hotel so they can have their traditional beef barbecues during FIFA World Cup 2022, as per reports. "We visited...campus several times and chose it because not only does it have great facilities but it also has open-air space for Asados (Argentinian custom of barbecue)," an Argentina FA official said.

76.title: 5 injured in Russian strike on aid station: Ukrainian Prez's aide
76.article_body: Five people were injured in a Russian strike on a humanitarian station in southern Ukraine, Kyrylo Tymoshenko, a senior Ukrainian presidential aide, said on Saturday. He said the centre had been handing out bread. The attack took place in a town just west of the city of Kherson, which Ukrainian troops recaptured from Russian forces last week, Tymoshenko informed.

77.title: Bulgaria charges 5 people over blast in Turkey's Istanbul
77.article_body: Bulgaria has charged five people, including a woman of Syrian Kurdish origin, in connection with the blast in Turkey's Istanbul on Sunday that killed six people, prosecutors said. The suspects were detained earlier this week, Bulgaria's chief prosecutor Ivan Geshev said on Saturday. They have been charged with "supporting terrorist acts in another country" and "human trafficking", Geshev added.

78.title: Four-time champion Sebastian Vettel qualifies 9th for final F1 race
78.article_body: Aston Martin driver and four-time F1 world champion Sebastian Vettel qualified ninth for Sunday's 2022 season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "I'm still in the zone now, but I'm sure it will be a big day tomorrow," said Vettel, who retires after the race. Red Bull's Max Verstappen took the pole position, ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and Ferrari's Charles Leclerc.

79.title: UK PM Sunak pays surprise visit to Kyiv, announces defence package
79.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Saturday paid a surprise visit to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sunak also announced a fresh air defence package for Ukraine, which Britain valued at $60 million. Zelenskyy posted a video of the meeting online, where the two leaders are seen smiling and shaking hands before beginning discussions on the Russian invasion.

80.title: If I play well, no one can stop me from getting into hockey WC team: Sumit
80.article_body: Indian midfielder Sumit said that if he plays well then no one can stop him from getting into the national squad for the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in January. "The Australia tour is really important before the WC...Australia is a really strong team [and] we will get good competition from them," 25-year-old Sumit said.

81.title: Not interested in Ronaldo's form, he's hungry to score: Portugal manager
81.article_body: Portugal manager Fernando Santos said he is "not interested in" Cristiano Ronaldo's recent form and believes the forward is "hungry" to score goals. "He has always been hungry - that's why he has stayed at the top of the game for so long," said Santos. He added that Ronaldo has a "huge hunger" to "make Portugal the world champions".

82.title: We're keen to begin talks with India on trade in digital services: Aus minister
82.article_body: Australia is keen to begin discussions with India on trade in digital services under a Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement, Australia's Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs Tim Watts said. He added that Australia "believes digital trade is a really worthwhile agenda". Watts stated that the responsible ministers from both nations had committed to starting negotiations in coming months.

83.title: Indira Gandhi was fiercely committed to all-inclusive patriotism: Sonia
83.article_body: On the occasion of ex-PM Indira Gandhi's birth anniversary, Congress MP Sonia Gandhi said that the former was fiercely committed to "all-inclusive patriotism". Sonia said that even Indira's critics recognised the "unchanging core of her personality, that defined who she was and what she did". Notably, Sonia was speaking at the Indira Gandhi Peace Prize ceremony in New Delhi.

84.title: Malaysia's ex-PM Mahathir suffers 1st election defeat in 53 years
84.article_body: Malaysia's 97-year-old former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad suffered his first election loss in 53 years on Saturday. Mahathir failed to retain his Langkawi island constituency in the Parliamentary election. Mohd Suhaimi Abdullah from the Perikatan alliance won the Langkawi island seat. The Perikatan alliance is led by former prime minister Muhyiddin Yassin.

85.title: Early winter snowstorm claims 2 lives in US' New York state
85.article_body: Two persons have died in the US' New York state due to heavy snowing. The snowstorm was described as an early winter "lake effect" from Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, which dumped about 4 feet of snow on Friday, Reuters news agency reported. Officials said the deaths occurred due to heart attacks caused by overexertion while clearing snow.

86.title: Suspected Congolese soldier killed after crossing border: Rwanda
86.article_body: A man wearing a Congolese army uniform was shot dead by Rwandan troops on Saturday, Rwanda's military said. After crossing into the Rwandan side of the Rwanda-Congo border, the unidentified soldier started firing at Rwandan guard towers, following which he was neutralised, the military added. Congolese officials said that no soldier on duty in the area had been reported missing.

87.title: Congress to distribute 100,000 copies of Constitution in Maharashtra
87.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday launched a campaign to distribute 100,000 copies of the Indian Constitution to the people of Maharashtra under the 'Save Democracy' initiative. The programme has been taken up by the Maharashtra Congress Scheduled Caste Department, which is led by Siddharth Hattiambire. The leader said the Constitution is under severe threat owing to the BJP government.

88.title: RCB's first IPL title will lead to more titles quickly: De Villiers
88.article_body: Former South African batter AB de Villiers said if Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) win their first IPL title, they could win quite a few rather quickly. "I think if RCB wins one then they'll probably win two, three, four quickly...hopefully RCB's turn is around the corner," said de Villiers. He added that T20 cricket is a "bit of a gamble".

89.title: Student groups clash outside university campus in Punjab, 4 injured
89.article_body: Four students sustained injuries when two groups allegedly clashed outside CT University campus in Punjab's Ludhiana district during a convocation ceremony on Friday. The clash allegedly took place between current and former students over some comments on an Instagram post. Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan was the chief guest at the convocation.

90.title: Video shows girl students making chapatis in Punjab school; probe on
90.article_body: A video showing some girl students of a government school in Punjab making chapatis has gone viral on social media. The students were reportedly making chapatis for mid-day meal in school. The school is located in Pathankot's Sujanpur. The school's principal said that an investigation is being conducted into the incident.

91.title: Wimbledon to allow female players dress code exemption over period concerns
91.article_body: Wimbledon will allow female players to wear dark-coloured undershorts from next year to ease anxiety over playing during their period. Wimbledon chief executive Sally Bolton said, "We're committed to supporting players and listening to their feedback." She added, "It's our hope that this rule adjustment will help players focus purely on...performance by relieving a potential source of anxiety."

92.title: If not us, would want to see Messi or Suarez win FIFA WC: Spain coach
92.article_body: Spain coach Luis Enrique said if his team doesn't win the FIFA World Cup, then he would like to see Lionel Messi's Argentina or Luis Suarez's Uruguay crowned champions. He added that "it would be very unfair" for Messi to retire without a World Cup. Enrique added that Spain has guessed who they will face in the Round of 16.

93.title: 5-time champion Djokovic defeats Fritz to reach final of ATP Finals
93.article_body: Five-time champion Novak Djokovic beat American Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-5), 7-6(8-6) in the semi-final of the ATP Finals in Turin on Saturday. "I didn't feel very reactive today or very comfortable...I am very pleased to have overcome this one," said Djokovic. The Serbian won his last Red Group match against Daniil Medvedev in three hours and 11 minutes on Friday.

94.title: Beating higher-ranked players at Asian Cup was an achievement for me: Manika
94.article_body: Following Manika Batra's bronze medal win after beating world number six Hina Hayata at Asian Cup, the world number 44 said defeating higher-ranked players was an achievement for her. The 27-year-old became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal in the tournament. Manika beat world number seven Chen Xingtong in pre-quarterfinal. She defeated 23rd-ranked Chen Szu-Yu in quarter-final.

95.title: Rohit Shetty took 4 years to get script right: Vivek on 'Indian Police...'
95.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, speaking about his upcoming web series 'Indian Police Force', said it's loaded with Rohit Shetty's signature larger-than-life narrative but the director has also adopted a realistic approach for the show. He added Rohit took four years to get the script right. "The scale, the passion with which Rohit has made this...he'll set a benchmark with [it]," said Vivek.

96.title: Was overwhelmed: Nishikori on shedding a tear for Federer at Tokyo event
96.article_body: Explaining why he shed a tear after meeting Roger Federer at an event in Tokyo, 2014 US Open runner-up Kei Nishikori said, "I was overwhelmed by the atmosphere." "And also my admiration for him. After that I've started considering him an opponent to beat though he's my idol," he added. It was Federer's first exhibition match since retiring from tennis.

97.title: Your legacy will live forever: Tabassum's granddaughter on actress' death
97.article_body: Tabassum's granddaughter Karishma Govil took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering the late actress. "Rest in peace, dadiji. Your smile, tenacity and legacy will live forever," she wrote, sharing some old pictures with her grandmother. Tabassum, who hosted the celebrity talk show 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan', passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday.

98.title: 'Trace, Target, Terminate' policy needed for all economic crimes: Shah
98.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the strategy of 'Trace, Target and Terminate' needs to be adopted for every level of economic crime. He made the remarks while addressing the 'No Money for Terror' Ministerial Conference on Counter-Terrorism Financing. India has decided to develop national and global databases on narcotics and economic offences, and terrorism, Shah added.

99.title: 5, including 3 BSF personnel, arrested for gang-rape in Rajasthan
99.article_body: Five men were arrested for allegedly gang-raping a woman in Sri Ganganagar, Rajasthan. The accused include one head constable and two constables of the Border Security Force. "The 35-year-old victim...said that persons known to her took her to a place on the pretext of buying her ghee...The accused took her to a secluded place...[and] then raped her," an official said.

100.title: 8 men arrested for smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati
100.article_body: Police arrested eight men for allegedly smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. "[We have] seized 85 red sandalwood logs from three areas of Tirupati. Four two-wheelers and one goods carrier [have] also [been] seized," said Circle Inspector, Ramakrishna. He added, "Search [operation] launched for smugglers who absconded [and] a case [has been] registered."

101.title: 25-yr-old hoists Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at Mt Friendship peak
101.article_body: A 25-year-old man named Chaman Lal Kose hoisted the Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at the peak of Mount Friendship, Himachal Pradesh, on Wednesday. The Chhattisgarh resident also raised another flag dedicated to CM Bhupesh Baghel. Kose said scaling the peak wasn't easy and his expedition was hit by avalanches. The peak lies at a height of 17,353 feet above sea level.

102.title: Censor board asks 'Bhediya' producers to change abusive words to 'gadha', 'sansad' to 'body'
102.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has asked the makers of 'Bhediya' to change certain abusive words in the movie to "gadha". It also asked the makers to replace 'Ganga Jamuna mix' with 'Ganga Jamuna juice'. It further asked them to change 'sansad' to 'body', 'PMO' to 'minister' and 'country' to 'logo'.

103.title: Brett Lee names his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, includes 4 Indians
103.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee has named his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, which includes four Indians. He included Alex Hales and Jos Buttler as openers, followed by Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav and Glenn Phillips. Other players in the team include Hardik Pandya, Shadab Khan, Sam Curran, Shaheen Afridi, Arshdeep Singh and Adil Rashid.

104.title: Prithvi Shaw is naturally destructive, simply flies: Aakash Chopra
104.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra said that 23-year-old Prithvi Shaw is a naturally destructive batter. "He (Shaw) is the guy who just takes off," Chopra said. "He is an absolute rocket, he simply flies. I am not saying he will fly in every match. [Jos] Buttler, [Alex] Hales or anyone else is also not seen flying in every match," he added.

105.title: Portugal captain Ronaldo lands in Qatar for FIFA World Cup amid controversy, pics surface
105.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo and his team members arriving at Hamad International Airport in Qatar's Doha ahead of FIFA World Cup 2022. Ronaldo has been involved in a controversy at Manchester United after he, in an interview, stated that he is being forced out of the club. As per reports, Manchester United will sue Ronaldo.

106.title: Man who killed partner in MP resort, shared video of body arrested
106.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police on Friday arrested the man who killed his partner in Jabalpur's Mekhala Resort from Rajasthan's Sirohi district. The accused, resident of Maharashtra, is a history-sheeter named in at least 37 cases in Nasik and Thane districts alone. The accused had posted videos of the victim lying dead in a room with a bedsheet covering her body.

107.title: Fabulous performances throughout: Sharath on Manika's bronze at Asian Cup
107.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal took to Twitter after compatriot Manika Batra became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal at Asian Cup and wrote, "Fabulous performances throughout. Many congratulations on winning a historical bronze medal." Former Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore tweeted, "Nation is proud of you. Best wishes for your future endeavours."

108.title: Employees union NITES writes to Labour Minister over Amazon layoffs
108.article_body: Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) has written a letter to Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav alleging that employees at Amazon in India are being forced to quit. As per the letter, Amazon has given a deadline to the employees until November 30 to complete the process. The letter added that Amazon has violated labour laws in the country.

109.title: Karthik was a specialist, he wasn't part of India XI in T20 WC semis: Parthiv
109.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India needs to identify their playing XI early in a World Cup year and stick with them till the tournament ends. "Dinesh Karthik was a specialist [in T20 World Cup 2022] and by the time...semi-finals came, he wasn't even part of...playing XI," he added. Karthik scored 14 runs in three innings in T20 World Cup 2022.

110.title: Kerala has become unsafe for women in last 6 years: Union Minister
110.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan claimed that Kerala has become unsafe for women in the last six years of the LDF-led government. "Two women were butchered recently. In Kochi, a woman was kidnapped and gang-raped. Such incidents bring shame to the state," he said. A woman was recently raped by three men in a car after she collapsed at a party.

111.title: Police question owner of Himachal guest house visited by Aftab, Shraddha
111.article_body: A three-member team of Delhi Police on Saturday questioned the owner of a guest house in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district where Shraddha Walkar and Aftab Poonawala stayed in April. Several police teams have reached Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh to question owners and staffers of hotels where the couple stayed. Aftab strangled his live-in partner Shraddha on May 18 in Delhi.

112.title: Nepal set for provisional and national elections on Sunday
112.article_body: Nepal will conduct provincial and national elections on Sunday. Over 17.9 million people are eligible to vote. The Federal Parliament has 275 seats, out of which 165 members are elected via direct voting and the rest via the proportional electoral system. The Provincial Assembly has 550 members, of which 330 are elected directly and the rest via the proportional method.

113.title: Ali Fazal to star in Anurag Basu's 'Life in a Metro 2': Reports
113.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu is reportedly working on the sequel to his 2007 film 'Life in a Metro'. "It's an ensemble cast film with...mix of familiar and new faces. Ali Fazal is already on board, while...casting of other leads is still in progress," a source was quoted as saying. The film is expected to go on floors in December, reports said.

114.title: Amit Shah to hold rallies in Guj's Tapi, Narmada ahead of Assembly polls
114.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday will hold two public rallies in Gujarat's Tapi and Narmada districts ahead of the Assembly elections. Shah is scheduled to hold meetings in Tapi's Nizar village at 2:30 pm and Narmada's Dediapada town at 4 pm. PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to hold rallies in Gujarat's Saurashtra from November 20 to November 22.

115.title: Man dies by suicide after losing Rae Bareli ZP chairperson election
115.article_body: A man who lost the Zilla Panchayat (ZP) Chairman election in Rae Bareli recently has died by suicide in Lucknow, police said. The deceased man had borrowed money to contest the election. Unable to clear the debt, he was hiding in Lucknow since October 31. The man had contested the election twice in six years and had lost both times.

116.title: Maharashtra govt to form squad for girls who elope: Minister Lodha
116.article_body: Maharashtra's Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Mangal Prabhat Lodha on Saturday said the government will set up a special squad to protect women who leave their parents' homes after a fight or elope with a partner. The decision comes in the wake of the Shraddha Walker murder case. Shraddha Walker was murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala.

117.title: 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar' for 2021-22 conferred to 39 schools
117.article_body: The Ministry of Education on Saturday conferred the national-level award under 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar 2021-22' to 39 schools from across the country. The schools selected from among the 8.23 lakh entries include 28 government and aided, while 11 are private schools. "Cash prizes of ₹60,000 to 34 schools (in overall category) and ₹20,000 (in sub-categories) were given," an official said.

118.title: Secularism, idea of India undermined in last 2 years: Chidambaram
118.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said all pillars of society, including political parties, are "gripped with fear" in the country. "Forces that are undermining the idea of India have been at work in the last 2-2.5 years," the former Union Minister said. He added that "the idea of India has been undermined" and secularism has been reduced to "embracing one religion".

119.title: Election symbols are not a party's exclusive property: Delhi HC
119.article_body: The Delhi High Court has said that political parties cannot consider election symbols as their "exclusive property". "The right to use the symbol can be lost with the dismal performance of the party," said the bench. The observations came while dismissing an appeal by Samata Party against the allotment of the 'flaming torch' symbol to the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena.

120.title: 'Prepared to walk away': EU on likelihood of a 'bad' COP27 deal
120.article_body: The EU warned on Saturday that it is "prepared to walk away" from the COP27 climate summit if negotiators fail to reach a suitable agreement on tackling the climate crisis. "We'd rather have no decision than a bad decision," the bloc's climate action chief Frans Timmermans said. "We believe that a positive result today is still within reach," he added.

121.title: God willing, I will fight next J&K Assembly polls: Farooq Abdullah
121.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday he will "Insha Allah" contest the next Assembly elections in the union territory. "Let them announce the dates, we will show them where they stand," Farooq said, referring to the BJP. Meanwhile, his son Omar Abdullah earlier said Farooq will not participate in the Jammu and Kashmir National Conference's next presidential elections.

122.title: World's most powerful telescope spots 'unusually bright' most distant galaxies
122.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope- the world's most powerful telescope, has spotted two "exceptionally bright" galaxies with "the most distant starlight that anyone had ever seen". "These two...galaxies could fundamentally alter what we know about the very first stars," said NASA, while releasing images. The galaxies existed approximately 450 and 350 million years after the big bang.

123.title: Honesty was premise of our relationship, that got eroded: Darshan on Akshay
123.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan, speaking about his equation with Akshay Kumar, said, "Honesty was the premise of my relationship with him, and somewhere, that got eroded." He added that the actor used to treat him like a guru. Suneel, who worked with Akshay in several films, further said he hasn't met the actor since the release of their 2005 film 'Dosti'.

124.title: Two arrested for bomb blast threat at Bharat Jodo Yatra in MP's Indore
124.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly threatening to blow up Khalsa Stadium in Madhya Pradesh's Indore during Bharat Jodo Yatra on November 28. Earlier this week, a letter threatening the bomb blast had come to light. It stated that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and the party's state unit chief Kamal Nath would be assassinated at the campaign's Indore halt.

125.title: India's target is to finish on podium of Hockey WC 2023: Midfielder Sumit
125.article_body: Indian men's hockey team midfielder Sumit said his side's target is to finish on the podium of next year's World Cup. "I still remember...2018 World Cup when we lost in the quarter-finals and every time I go back to Bhubaneswar, it reminds me of that loss," he added. World Cup will be played in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela, beginning January 13.

126.title: Centre using CBI, ED, I-T dept as 'Trishul' against non-BJP govts: CPI(M)
126.article_body: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat on Saturday accused the Centre of using ED, CBI and Income Tax Department as its 'Trishul' (trident) against governments of non-BJP parties in states. She said what Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren is facing is "not a question of one person, but it is an attack on constitutional place of Opposition in a democratic country".

127.title: Reaching T20 WC 2022 semi-finals can be considered an achievement: Ashwin
127.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign cannot be called "disappointing". He added, "We lost in the semi-finals. Reaching the semi-finals and finals can be considered an achievement. But from an Indian fan's point of view, and the expectations they have of this team, I totally understand the disappointment from the fans."

128.title: K'taka Congress files complaint with SEC over 'voter fraud' by BJP
128.article_body: Congress has filed a complaint with the Karnataka State Election Commission (SEC) against "electoral fraud" in the state, allegedly at the behest of CM Basavaraj Bommai. Congress has alleged that BJP minister CN Ashwath Narayan and his team stole voter data and deleted lakhs of votes. CM Bommai said he has ordered a probe into the matter.

129.title: No country alone can defeat borderless threat of terrorism: Shah
129.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said the international community must rise above "geo-political interests" against the "borderless threat" of terrorism. "In these terror havens, it's necessary to shackle their unrestrained activities along with economic crackdown," said Shah. Stating that no country can fight the threat alone, he added that some countries have made terrorism their state policy.

130.title: Federal Bank partners with JCB India to provide heavy equipment financing
130.article_body: Federal Bank announced on Friday that it has partnered with JCB India to expand its loan portfolio and fund potential buyers of heavy construction equipment. According to a statement by the lender, the partnership would increase the financing alternatives for JCB consumers in India. Under the arrangement, JCB's customers can avail loans from the lender at competitive interest rates.

131.title: It wasn't dad's decision: Jatin Pandit's son on split with Lalit Pandit
131.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit's son Raahul Jatin has said his father never wanted to split with his long-time collaborator and brother Lalit Pandit. "It was never dad's decision and we're still waiting on uncle," he added. Raahul added that Jatin was "really bummed out" after splitting with Lalit. Jatin and Lalit parted ways after working on the 2006 film 'Fanaa'.

132.title: SRK recommended me for Dil Se, Mani said 'can't have 2 similar actresses': Divya
132.article_body: Divya Dutta revealed that Shah Rukh Khan had recommended her name to director Mani Ratnam for his 1998 film 'Dil Se'. She added on his recommendation, Mani messaged her, saying he won't be able to cast her as she looks "similar" to lead actress Manisha Koirala. She recalled the filmmaker saying, "I can't have two similar actresses in one film."

133.title: T'gana Cong expels Shashidhar Reddy for 6 yrs over 'anti-party activities'
133.article_body: Telangana Congress on Saturday expelled senior party leader M Shashidhar Reddy for a period of six years over "anti-party activities". The action against Reddy came after his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar. Reddy also allegedly passed several comments against TPCC President Revanth Reddy and his style of functioning.

134.title: India planning to showcase Nagaland’s Hornbill Festival at G20
134.article_body: India is planning to showcase Nagaland's Hornbill Festival after it assumes the presidency of G20 on December 1. G20 Chief Coordinator Harsh Vardhan Shringla recently discussed the opportunities to showcase the festival with Nagaland CM Neiphu Rio. "India's G20 is an opportunity for the state of Nagaland to showcase its cultural diversity, uniqueness and tourism potential," Shringla said.

135.title: Russia trying to exhaust Kyiv's air defence supplies: Pentagon official
135.article_body: The recent surge in Russia's missile strikes in Ukraine is partly aimed at exhausting Kyiv's air defence supplies to clear the path for the domination of Ukraine's skies, the Pentagon's top policy advisor has said. "We're committed to making sure...that the Ukrainians get what they need to keep their air defences viable," Colin Kahl told reporters on Saturday.

136.title: Case filed against AMU student who was attacked during cricket match
136.article_body: A countercase has been registered against the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) student who was allegedly hit on the head during a cricket match. The case has been filed following a report by the accused's father and the insistence of BJP MLC Manvendra Pratap Singh. The victim, Sajid Husain, was hit on the head by fellow second-year student Shobhit Singh.

137.title: Gem, jewellery exports fell 15% to ₹25,844 crore in Oct: Data
137.article_body: The gem and jewellery exports declined 14.64% year-over-year in October at ₹25,843.84 crore as against ₹30,274.64 crore from the year-ago period, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said. The decline in exports in October or November is a seasonal trend as manufacturing activities are either limited or units are closed because of Diwali, GJEPC stated.

138.title: Playing T10 league has helped improve my game against spin: Hales
138.article_body: England batter Alex Hales said that playing Abu Dhabi T10 has definitely helped him in improving his batting against spin bowling. "It's still an area (spin) that I'm looking to get better at, so I'll be sure to...top up as much as I can," Hales said. He added that he is pretty familiar with what to expect in UAE conditions.

139.title: Haryana village gifts SUV, ₹2 crore to defeated Sarpanch candidate
139.article_body: To avoid bitterness, residents of Chiri village in Haryana gifted an SUV car and ₹2.11 crore to a candidate who lost the Sarpanch elections on November 12. Dharmpal Dalal alias Kala, who was overwhelmed by the gesture, said, "I'll contribute to the village welfare activities like before after today's gesture." He lost the elections to Naveen Dalal by 66 votes.

140.title: 2 injured as autorickshaw explodes in Mangaluru, police say 'remain calm'
140.article_body: An autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. "They are undergoing treatment and are unable to speak now. We request the public not to spread rumours. They should remain calm and not panic," Mangaluru City Police Commissioner N Shashi Kumar said. "The driver alleged he spotted the fire," he added.

141.title: 'Can't take Indian photos due to lighting' sign at Australian post office sparks row
141.article_body: A sign that said "Due to our lighting and quality of photo background, we, unfortunately, CAN NOT take INDIAN photos" was seen at a post office in Adelaide city of South Australia, sparking criticism. A picture of the sign was posted on Twitter, following which Australia Post said, "We're sincerely sorry for the offence caused by this unauthorised sign."

142.title: Activist Navlakha released from jail, to be put under house arrest
142.article_body: Activist Gautam Navlakha, accused in the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case, was released from Taloja jail and handed over to Navi Mumbai Police for house arrest on Saturday. This comes after the Supreme Court on Thursday allowed Navlakha to be shifted to house arrest for a month. Navlakha had approached the SC saying that he was suffering from health issues.

143.title: Centre to spend ₹50,000 cr on infrastructural development of Arunachal: PM
143.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said the Centre is going to spend ₹50,000 crore in near future for the infrastructural development of Arunachal Pradesh. PM Modi, who inaugurated the Donyi Polo Airport at Hollongi, said that the state has great potential for tourism. With the development of the new airport, farmers can sell their produce to bigger markets, he added.

144.title: 8, including 3 women, injured in ordnance factory explosion in TN
144.article_body: Eight persons, including three women, were injured in an explosion at an ordnance factory near Coonoor in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris on Saturday, an official said. The explosion occurred at 8:20 am in the cordite section, the factory's Deputy General Manager T Sanker said. Since workers weren't present in the section during the explosion, there were no grievous injuries, he added.

145.title: Air India in talks with Airbus, Boeing for 'historic order': CEO Wilson
145.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft, the airline's CEO Campbell Wilson said. "We're in deep discussion with Boeing, Airbus...for a historic order of the latest generation aircraft that will power Air India's medium- and long-term growth," he added. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes.

146.title: Loco pilot, his assistant run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in J'khand
146.article_body: A loco pilot and his assistant were killed after they were run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in Jharkhand, a Railways official said on Saturday. The incident took place when the duo, posted at Chakradharpur, was changing the engine of a goods train. The passenger train was going through an adjacent line, the official added.

147.title: Rohit, Rahul, Kohli are on wrong side of 30s: Aakash on top 3 in T20Is
147.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said some adjustments need to be made in India's top three in T20Is considering the next T20 World Cup in 2024. He added that Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli are on the wrong side of thirties. While Rohit and Kohli are 35 and 34 years old respectively, Rahul turned 30 in April this year.

148.title: Tesla recalls 3,21,000 vehicles in US over rear light issue
148.article_body: Tesla is recalling more than 3,21,000 vehicles in US because one or both tail lights may intermittently fail to illuminate, according to a filing with US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The Texas-based EV maker said the recall affects some 2023 Model 3 and 2020-2023 Model Y vehicles. Tesla will deploy an over-the-air update to correct the issue.

149.title: Shivaji an old idol, find new ones like Nitin Gadkari: Maha Governor
149.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari faced criticism from Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena on Saturday for calling Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol'. "You can find new (idols), from Babasaheb Ambedkar to Nitin Gadkari," he said. "Shivaji...is not only our deity but our source of inspiration. He will always be the idol for...us," a spokesman from Uddhav's Shiv Sena said.

150.title: UP Police cancels leaves of all its personnel in view of polls
150.article_body: UP Police has cancelled the leaves of all of its personnel in view of the upcoming parliamentary and Assembly by-polls, and local body elections. A directive issued in this regard on Saturday said the leaves had been cancelled with immediate effect till the completion of the election process. Concerned officers, however, have been authorised to grant leaves in special cases.

151.title: Women can fulfil dreams post marriage: BJP Guj candidate Rivaba Jadeja
151.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba, who's a BJP candidate in Gujarat Assembly elections, said on Saturday, "I want to inspire couples that women can fulfil their dreams after marriage." Praising Ravindra for supporting her, she said, "My husband is like a booster dose for me." Rivaba added, "It's...important that behind the success of every woman, there's her husband and brother."

152.title: Radisson Blu Ghaziabad owner Amit Jain found dead at Delhi flat
152.article_body: Amit Jain, the owner of Radisson Blu hotel in UP's Ghaziabad has been found dead, reports said on Saturday. Jain's body was found hanging at his residential flat in Delhi's Khel Gaon and suicide is suspected, police said. His body has reportedly been sent for post-mortem. As per reports, Jain was distressed due to business losses.

153.title: Retired IAS officer Arun Goel appointed Election Commissioner
153.article_body: Retired bureaucrat Arun Goel was on Saturday appointed Election Commissioner in the Election Commission of India (ECI), the Law and Justice Ministry said. The 1985 batch ex-IAS officer was appointed to the post of the third Election Commissioner. The post was vacant after the then-Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar took the charge as the Chief Election Commissioner in May this year.

154.title: Uddhav must dump Cong over Rahul's remarks against Savarkar: BJP leader
154.article_body: BJP leader Raosaheb Patil Danve on Saturday said Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray must break his party's alliance with Congress over Rahul Gandhi's remarks on VD Savarkar. "Balasaheb Thackeray spread the message of Swatantryaveer Savarkar across Maharashtra, and now his son and grandson are sitting with a party that insults...[him]," Danve said, adding Rahul Gandhi has no knowledge of history.

155.title: Savarkar apologised to British to move out of jail: Tushar Gandhi
155.article_body: Freedom Fighter Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi commented after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused VD Savarkar of writing mercy petitions to the British. "It is true that Savarkar was friendly with the British, he apologised to the British just to move out of prison, and it is not...taken from WhatsApp University, there is evidence in history," Tushar said.

156.title: Video shows cow roaming inside MP govt hospital, 3 staffers fired
156.article_body: A video showing a cow roaming in the ICU ward of a district hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh has surfaced online. The incident reportedly took place on Friday, following which three staff members and a security guard were expelled. As per reports, the cow entered the building, although cow catchers are deployed at the hospital to prevent such mishaps.

157.title: Video shows students made to climb roof to fill water tank in UP school
157.article_body: A video showing two students filling a water tank on the school's roof in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi has surfaced on social media. The video shows a man handing over a bucket to a student standing on the roof. He then passes the bucket to another student who fills the water tank. The school is reported to be Islampur Primary School.

158.title: Funny: Suniel Shetty on Mehul Choksi alleging 'File No 323' defames him
158.article_body: Reacting to Mehul Choksi sending legal notice to makers of 'File No 323' for allegedly making an attempt to defame him, actor Suniel Shetty said, "I don't know where that has come from." He added, "Whole thing of him being defamed is funny." He further stated the director and producers are making something from whatever is available in public domain.

159.title: I sucked, it's a disaster: Medvedev on failing to close out match vs Djokovic
159.article_body: Following the loss after failing to serve out his final round-robin match against Novak Djokovic in ATP Finals, Daniil Medvedev said, "I sucked, so that's what happened. It's a disaster." Medvedev remained winless and finished last in Red Group. "I'm going to try to be better next time," the 2020 champion added. Medvedev lost 3-6, 7-6(7-5), 6-7(2-7).

160.title: Neha Kakkar & I were rejected from Indian Idol on same day: Ayushmann
160.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, in an episode of 'Indian Idol 13', revealed that he and Neha Kakkar had once auditioned for the show and got rejected on the same day. "We were returning...to Delhi on...same train, we were about fifty people who got rejected together. Today she's the judge here and I'm on her show, it...really means a lot," he added.

161.title: Jaguar Land Rover opens 800 roles to hire fired Meta, Twitter workers
161.article_body: Tata Motors-owned luxury carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said it's looking to recruit tech workers who were recently laid off by companies like Meta, Twitter and Amazon. The company announced a job portal to fill 800 roles in areas like self-driving, electrification, machine learning and data science. The recruitment will be conducted in UK, Ireland, US, India, China and Hungary.

162.title: 4 arrested in Bengaluru for trying to sell items made of elephant ivory
162.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested four people for allegedly trying to sell items made out of elephant ivory. The police recovered ivory material of around 7.5 kilograms from the accused. "A bracelet, boxes, door handles, irregular artwork, a knife made of deer, amber containing a scorpion, walking sticks, elephant idols and other valuables were seized from the accused," police said.

163.title: Delhi recorded coldest morning of the season today with 9°C min temperature
163.article_body: Delhi on Saturday recorded its coldest morning of this season with the minimum temperature falling to 9°C, said the India Meteorological Department. On the day, the maximum temperature was expected to be 26°C. Relative humidity was 83% at 8.30 am. On Friday, the minimum temperature in Delhi was 9.6°C and the maximum temperature was 25.9°C.

164.title: 3 school children drown after entering village tank to play in Hyd
164.article_body: Three school children drowned in a village tank in Hyderabad's Nanakramguda on Saturday. "The children didn't know how to swim and entered the tank to play," Gachibowli SHO G Suresh said. The deceased have been identified as 15-year-old Shahbaz, 12-year-old Deepak and 13-year-old Pavan. They were residents of Telecom Nagar, Gachibowli.

165.title: Satyendar Jain moves court against ED over leaked massage video
165.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's legal team on Saturday moved a special court with an application seeking contempt action against Enforcement Directorate (ED) over a leaked CCTV video showing the AAP leader getting a massage. "The court will hear on Monday how did BJP get the confidential footage and why it was circulated," Jain's lawyer Mohd Irshad tweeted.

166.title: My team said 'What's wrong with you?': Madhur on casting Prateik in 'India...'
166.article_body: Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar opened up about how his team wasn't sure about getting Prateik Babbar on board for the role of a migrant worker in the upcoming film 'India Lockdown'. "They all said, 'Sir, what's wrong with you? Why would Prateik play...migrant worker? This isn't...elite role'," he said, adding, "I said, 'I'll put him into work. Leave it to me'."

167.title: AIIMS Delhi to start smart card payment facility from April 2023
167.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi is set to start an "AIIMS Smart Card facility" for making payments from April 1 next year. The facility aims to make the payment procedure easier for patients and help them avoid queues. The AIIMS' finance division is collaborating with the State Bank of India to start this facility.

168.title: Timing of beer ban at FIFA WC is unfortunate: German team director
168.article_body: Germany team director Oliver Bierhoff said that the timing of the beer ban at the stadiums during the FIFA World Cup in Qatar is unfortunate. "Such a short-notice decision (on beer)...creates unease...This (beer) is a part of the tournament but I cannot really understand...because there was enough time to take such a decision earlier," Bierhoff said.

169.title: Yerawada Jail havaldar, canteen staffer arrested for seeking bribe
169.article_body: A havaldar and a canteen staffer of the Yerawada Jail in Pune have been arrested for allegedly demanding a bribe from a convict who is presently out on parole. The Anti-Corruption Bureau identified the arrested as Havaldar Bajirao Patil (54) and canteen staffer Rihana Asif Sayyad (48). The complainant alleged that Patil had demanded a bribe of ₹50,000.

170.title: Alibag woman cheated of ₹1.12 crore by online 'friend from England'
170.article_body: A case has been registered against unknown persons for cheating a retired court superintendent based in Alibag, near Mumbai, of ₹1.12 crore. She befriended a man on social media who claimed to be from England and said he had sent her gifts, for which she needed to pay customs duty. Once the money was transferred, the accused stopped all communication.

171.title: Over 400 Ukrainian children killed since Russian invasion: Kyiv
171.article_body: At least 437 Ukrainian children have been killed and more than 837 have been injured so far as a result of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Ukrainian Prosecutor General's office said on Saturday. Officials said the figures were "not final" as they were still verifying information from zones of active fighting, liberated areas and Russian-occupied territories.

172.title: PCMC to set up ICUs using ventilators received during COVID-19 outbreak
172.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) is planning to set up more intensive care units (ICUs) in its hospitals by using around 300 ventilators that it received during the COVID-19 outbreak. These 300 ventilators are presently unused and stored in the civic body's hospital in Masulkar Colony. PCMC got the ventilators from the government and through donations and CSR funds.

173.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi due to religious procession on Sunday
173.article_body: Delhi Police has issued a traffic advisory for 'Feast of the Christ the King' procession that will begin from St Columba's School at 10:30 am and conclude at 12:00 pm on Sunday. The procession will cover Gol Dak Khana, Baba Kharak Singh Marg, Connaught Place, Gol Market etc. Police have urged citizens to plan their commute accordingly.

174.title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-ABG Shipyard chief, 24 others in ₹23,000-cr bank fraud case
