174.article_body: The CBI today filed a chargesheet against ex-ABG Shipyard Chairman Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal and 24 others in a ₹23,000-crore bank fraud case. In September, the CBI had arrested Rishi in connection with the case. The ABG Shipyard had created a web of transactions to cheat a consortium of 28 banks to the tune of ₹22,842 crore between 2012 and 2017.

175.title: I don't want to reveal: Novak on mid-match trembles vs Medvedev in ATP Finals
175.article_body: Following his three-hour 11-minute win against Daniil Medvedev in Red Group at ATP Finals in Turin, Novak Djokovic, who was seen gasping for breath and shaking mid-match, said, "I don't want to reveal what I'm going through exactly to my opponents." Djokovic finished the round-robin stage with a 3-0 record after defeating Medvedev 6-3, 6-7(5-7), 7-6(7-2) on Friday.

176.title: Co-prisoners gave massage to Satyendar Jain, it's not allowed: Ex-Tihar PRO
176.article_body: Sunil Gupta, ex-PRO of Tihar jail, said the video of Delhi minister Satyendar Jain receiving massage in jail clearly shows that co-prisoners were giving him massage. "The massage that he was being given inside the cell is not permissible under jail rules," Gupta added. He stressed that inmates can be given physiotherapy in physiotherapy centres by physiotherapists or trained experts.

177.title: Man kills 6-year-old son after fight with wife in Mumbai, detained
177.article_body: A man has been arrested for killing his 6-year-old son after an alleged fight with his wife in Mumbai's Malad. The woman found her son's body on the floor when she returned after dropping their daughter at school. During interrogation, police found that the couple used to fight over minor disputes, the details of which are yet to be revealed.

178.title: Zomato confirms laying off under 3% staff nationwide
178.article_body: Online food delivery service Zomato on Saturday confirmed that it will lay off under 3% of its staff nationwide. The company stated that the laying offs are based on regular performance. "There has been a regular performance-based churn of under 3 per cent of our workforce, there's nothing more to it," a Zomato spokesperson said.

179.title: Hijab protesters set fire to home of Iran's Islamic regime's founder, video surfaces
179.article_body: Anti-hijab protesters in Iran set fire to the old home of former supreme leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini who founded the current Islamic Republic of Iran. The home-turned-museum of Khomeini was reportedly set ablaze using petrol bombs with videos of the arson surfacing online. The protests that began with 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in police custody have entered their third month.

180.title: Actress Tabassum passes away due to cardiac arrest
180.article_body: Veteran actress Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday night. "She was absolutely healthy...It happened all of a sudden," her son Hoshang Govil said. Tabassum started her career as a child actor in 1947. She also hosted popular Doordarshan celebrity talk show 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan' from 1972 to 1993.

181.title: Manika creates history: Rijiju on TT player's bronze medal win at Asian Cup
181.article_body: After Manika Batra won a bronze medal at Asian Cup, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju tweeted, "Manika Batra creates history by becoming the first-ever Indian female paddler to win a medal at the prestigious Asian Cup." He added, "She defeated world number six and three-time Asian champion Hina Hayata!! Congratulations." The 27-year-old won the bronze medal match 4-2.

182.title: SC judge recuses from hearing pleas against ED chief's tenure extension
182.article_body: SC judge Justice SK Kaul on Friday recused himself from hearing the petitions challenging the tenure extension granted to ED chief Sanjay Kumar Mishra last year. Justice Kaul said that the matter would be listed before a bench of which he is not a part. The Centre on Thursday granted a third one-year tenure extension to Mishra as ED chief.

183.title: I've chat, recordings of your gang of thugs: Conman Sukesh warns Kejriwal
183.article_body: In a letter against AAP from prison, conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar accused Satyendar Jain of seeking help to convert $20 million into Indian rupees and bitcoin in 2017 and said he has evidence to back his claims. "I've each and every chat and recordings of your gang of "thugs"," he said. He also asked Kejriwal to agree to a polygraph test.

184.title: Cyberabad Police launch 'My Transport is Safe' app to ensure easy travel
184.article_body:
Cyberabad Police on Friday launched 'My Transport is Safe' application to ensure safe and easy travel. Through the application, unique QR code stickers have been given to vehicles with special permission during no-entry times, considering traffic congestion and public safety. 
"All...details related to the vehicle like validity, route and other...details are included in the QR code," police said.

185.title: World economy could lose $1.4 tn if divided into 2 blocs: IMF chief
185.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said Ukraine-Russia conflict and increase in trade restrictions against China and other countries could cost the global economy $1.4 trillion. "The world is going to lose 1.5% of GDP just because of division that may split us into two trading blocs," Georgieva said. "The sooner the war ends, the better," she added.

186.title: BR Ambedkar was probably India's first male feminist: Shashi Tharoor
186.article_body: BR Ambedkar was probably India's first male feminist, said writer and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday. He added that between 1920s-1940s, Ambedkar made speeches, including in front of a female audience, which today would be considered as progressive for male politicians. Tharoor further said that Ambedkar urged women to delay marriage and stand up to their husbands as equals.

187.title: Telangana govt encourages farmers for oil palm cultivation: KTR
187.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the state government was initiating steps to encourage farmers to cultivate oil palm and oil seed in the days to come. Efforts are being made to convert 20 lakh-acre of paddy fields into oil palm in five years, he said. This way, the government can reduce import dependence on edible oils, he added.

188.title: Dalai Lama honoured with Gandhi Mandela Award in Himachal
188.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama on Saturday was honoured with the Gandhi Mandela Award by the Gandhi Mandela Foundation at the Tsuglagkhang Temple in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh. While accepting the award, the leader said, "Any problem cannot be solved by war, but through dialogue and peace." He received the medal from Himachal Pradesh Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar.

189.title: Private firm owner, aide held for ₹20.96 cr GST fraud in Navi Mumbai
189.article_body: The Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) officials in Navi Mumbai arrested a company owner and his aide for allegedly passing on fake input tax credit of ₹20.96 crore, an official said. The officials arrested the proprietor of two companies "Storage Miles and Catbus" and his accomplice. Firms allegedly utilised input tax credit of ₹10.48 crore received from fake entities.

190.title: Couple invites Indian Army to their wedding in Kerala, Army replies
190.article_body: A Kerala couple while inviting the Indian Army for their wedding on 10th November, said, "We owe a deep debt of gratitude to you for keeping us safe." They added, "Thank you for giving us happy days with our loved ones." Indian Army shared the note on Instagram, saying, "Army...wishes the couple a very happy & blissful wedded life."

191.title: How does 2022 FIFA World Cup's prize money compare with that of cricket World Cups?
191.article_body: The winners of 2022 FIFA World Cup will receive a prize money of $42 million, while the runners-up will get $30 million. England, the winners of T20 World Cup 2022, received $1.6 million, while Pakistan, who were the runners-up, took home $800,000. England, the winners of the 10-team 2019 ODI World Cup, received $4 million in prize money.

192.title: Today I feel gay, I feel disabled, I feel like migrant worker: FIFA Prez ahead of Qatar WC
192.article_body: During his speech on 2022 FIFA World Cup eve, FIFA President Gianni Infantino said, "Today I feel Qatari. Today I feel Arabic. Today I feel African. Today I feel gay. Today I feel disabled. Today I feel (like) a migrant worker." Responding to treatment of LGBTQ people in Qatar, Infantino said that more open laws were "part of a process".

193.title: Drugs worth over ₹61 crore seized by EC since November 3 in Gujarat
193.article_body: The surveillance teams of the Election Commission and the Gujarat Police have seized 817 kg of drugs worth over ₹61 crore since the notification of the Gujarat Assembly elections was issued on November 3. The state Chief Electoral Officer claimed that 51 illegal weapons and 274 illegal ammunition have also been confiscated till now.

194.title: Shehnaaz scolds bodyguard as he pushes fan, tells him 'I want to take pics'
194.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, who was in Dubai for an event, scolded a bodyguard when he allegedly pushed a fan who was trying to take a picture with her. In a video that surfaced online, she can be seen telling the bodyguard that she wants to take pictures with the fans. "What happened?" she can be seen asking the bodyguard.

195.title: Aamir dances to 'Papa Kehte...' at daughter's engagement party, video surfaces
195.article_body: A video showing Aamir Khan dancing to 'Papa Kehte Hain' at his daughter Ira Khan's engagement party on Friday has surfaced. In the video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani, Ira could be seen cheering for Aamir and his cousin Mansoor Khan as they grooved to the song. 'Papa Kehte Hain' was a part of Aamir's 'Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak'.

196.title: India's T20 WC 2007 triumph set to be turned into web series: Report
196.article_body: India's 2007 T20 World Cup-winning campaign is reportedly set to be turned into a web series. "A multi-language documentary web series on the 2007 T20 Cricket World Cup...is officially announced...It is set to release in 2023," film critic Taran Adarsh tweeted. Notably, the series is being directed by Anand Kumar and is produced by UK-based 'One One Six Network'.

197.title: Twinkle had issues with Priyanka: Suneel recalls Akshay opting out of 'Barsaat'
197.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan opened up about why Akshay Kumar dropped out of his production 'Barsaat'. He said Akshay told him that he was having some issues with his dates. "By then, I had also got to know of...other issues that had come up between him and his wife. She (Twinkle Khanna) had issues with Priyanka, I was told," Suneel said.

198.title: Over 83,000 Russian soldiers killed by our forces so far: Ukraine
198.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that its forces have killed around 83,880 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Around 2,885 Russian tanks and over 535 aircraft, including 261 helicopters, have also been destroyed, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. It further estimated that its troops have destroyed 5,815 armoured personnel carriers and 393 multiple launch rocket systems.

199.title: Mumbai's British-era Carnac bridge to be cut into 44 pieces
199.article_body: Mumbai's British-era Carnac bridge which is to be demolished on Saturday and Sunday will be cut into 44 pieces in a 27-hour operation. "They'll be cut with the help of 50 gas cutters...and...about 300 gas cylinders will be utilized," a Central Railway official said. "Total manpower of 400 plus...will be used to carry out the operation smoothly," he added.

200.title: Kejriwal swindled money meant for children's education: Sukesh in new letter
200.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of misappropriating money meant for children's education. "You want to make money in the name of Delhi School Model...Satyendar Ji, Manish Ji only matter is greed for money," Sukesh wrote in his seventh letter against AAP from jail. Earlier, Sukesh had alleged he arranged the PR for AAP's Delhi schools' story.

201.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
201.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Saturday, with Bihar's Darbhanga and Motihari having the highest AQI at 394 and 377, respectively. This is followed by Siwan (366), Bettiah (362), Katihar (358), Chapra (330), Saharsa (315), Samastipur (309) and Muzaffarpur (303). All the cities fall under 'very poor' category of air quality.

202.title: Educated women have double standards, women are their own enemies: Jaya
202.article_body: Actress Jaya Bachchan said that educated women also have double standards. "[It] is so sad. I want to say it sometimes but do not feel good about saying it, but women are their own enemies," she added. Jaya also said that raising up the kids is not just a mother's, but also the father's responsibility.

203.title: 'Brought through proper channel': Man accused of abducting son from Ukraine
203.article_body: A man who has been accused by his Ukrainian ex-wife of kidnapping their three-year-old son has claimed before the Delhi HC that his son is an Indian citizen. While replying to his ex-wife's petition, the man argued that an "Indian citizen cannot be sent to a war zone". He stated that his son was brought to India "through proper channels".

204.title: India to add $1 trillion to GDP every 12-18 months within next decade: Adani
204.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Saturday said India will start adding a trillion dollar to its gross domestic product (GDP) every 12-18 months within the next decade. "It took us 58 years to get to our first trillion dollars of GDP, 12 years to get to the next trillion and just five years for the third trillion," Adani said.

205.title: FTX launches strategic review of assets, seeks court relief to pay vendors
205.article_body: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX said that it is launching a strategic review of its global assets as a part of the bankruptcy process. FTX sought court relief to allow the operation of a new global cash management system and payment to its critical vendors. FTX said the failure to receive the relief will result in "immediate and irreparable harm".

206.title: Rahul Gandhi met 'anti-national pastors' during padyatra: Tejasvi Surya
206.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against VD Savarkar and accused him of involving 'anti-national pastors' in the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "It appears that it is more like a 'Bharat Todo Andolan' by uniting anti-nationals on a single platform. Former PM late Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru also targeted Veer Savarkar several times," said Surya.

207.title: 5 killed as car falls into gorge in U'khand, 2nd accident in 2 days
207.article_body: Five persons were killed and one was seriously injured when the car in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in the Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand on Saturday around 11 am. The woman who was injured is critical. A day earlier, 12 persons were killed when a pick-up vehicle fell into a gorge in the Chamoli district.

208.title: Labourer contesting Guj polls pays ₹10,000 deposit in ₹1 coins
208.article_body: Mahendra Patni, a daily wage worker who is contesting as an independent candidate from Gujarat's Gandhinagar North seat, submitted ₹10,000 deposit in ₹1 coins. He carried the coins in two sacks and said he spent three days collecting them. He said his and 520 other huts were demolished to build a 5-star-hotel and revamp the Gandhinagar railway station.

209.title: It's getting 1 million votes/hour: Musk on poll to reinstate Trump on Twitter
209.article_body: After starting a Twitter poll asking users whether former US President Donald Trump should be reinstated on the platform, Twitter CEO Elon Musk gave an update saying, "Trump poll getting ~1M votes/hour!" Twitter permanently suspended Trump after the US Capitol riots in January 2021. Earlier, Musk tweeted saying the voice of the people is the voice of God.

210.title: Pak intruder killed as Army foils infiltration bid in J&K's Rajouri
210.article_body: The Indian Army foiled an infiltration bid by suspected terrorists along the LOC in the Rajouri district of Jammu & Kashmir, an official said on Saturday. A Pakistani intruder was killed while trying to negotiate a minefield during the failed infiltration attempt, as per officials cited by ANI. The incident took place in the Naushera sector, as per news reports.

211.title: NMMC starts special survey in Navi Mumbai to check measles cases
211.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has started a special survey wherein health workers will visit each household to find out if there are any suspected cases of measles. They will also check if babies up to five years have been vaccinated or not. The survey will be completed by November 30. The city is currently reeling under measles outbreak.

212.title: Man cheated of over ₹40 lakh on pretext of marriage in Karnataka
212.article_body: A man was allegedly cheated of over ₹40 lakh by a woman on the pretext of marriage in the Vijayapura district of Karnataka. According to the police, the accused sent him a friend request on Facebook and started chatting with him. The accused claimed that she has become an IAS officer and made him transfer the money through multiple transactions.

213.title: Men cheat 620 people of ₹15 cr on pretext of offering jobs, held in Hyd
213.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested four men for cheating around 620 people on the pretext of offering them jobs. The prime accused has been identified as Deepak Sharma, CEO of a Ghaziabad-based company. The accused offered a work-from-home job to digitise/scan old books. They collected a total of about ₹15 crore from the victims in the name of caution deposit.

214.title: Van driver arrested for molesting 9-year-old schoolgirl in Mumbai
214.article_body: A 25-year-old van driver was arrested for allegedly molesting a 9-year-old schoolgirl in Mumbai. The incident happened when the accused, Suresh Bhalerao, was dropping the girl at her home in Mulund from her school. The girl told her mother that Bhalerao touched her inappropriately and allegedly threatened her not to tell anyone about the incident, police said.

215.title: Speeding truck runs over vegetable vendor on Kharar-Kurali Highway, probe on
215.article_body: A 35-year-old vegetable vendor was killed after a speeding truck ran over him on the Kharar-Kurali Highway. The incident took place at around 6:20 pm on Friday. "The truck driver fled after the incident. We are trying to identify him," Kharar Station House Officer, Inspector Yogesh Kumar said. Reports said that the vendor had attached his stall to a motorcycle.

216.title: We have world's oldest language Tamil: PM at Kashi Tamil Sangamam
216.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday hailed Tamil as the world's oldest language at the Kashi Tamil Sangamam event in Varanasi. "We have the world's oldest language. It is still alive and popular as ever," said PM Modi. "People around the world are amazed when they know India is home to the oldest language of the world," he added.

217.title: You will survive: FIFA chief as fans criticise Qatar World Cup alcohol ban
217.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has reacted to criticism from World Cup fans over a ban on alcohol sales around stadiums. "I think personally if for three hours a day you cannot drink a beer, you will survive," said Infantino. Alcohol will be available at FIFA fan festivals, other fan destinations, and licensed venues.

218.title: CCTV video shows Aftab with bag at 4am on Oct 18, police suspect he has body parts
218.article_body: Aftab Ameen Poonawala, who has been accused of killing his live-in girlfriend Shraddha Walkar in Delhi, was purportedly seen walking with a bag outside his home in a CCTV footage recorded on October 18 at around 4 am. Police suspect that he's going to throw Shraddha's chopped body parts. He allegedly killed Shraddha on May 18.

219.title: Madras HC grants conditional bail to YouTuber Savukku Shankar
219.article_body: The Madras High Court on Friday granted conditional bail to YouTuber Savukku Shankar. This comes after the Supreme Court last week suspended the six-month imprisonment sentence awarded to him by the HC for contempt of court. The high court ordered Shankar not to make any comments on social media or indulge in any activities offending the judiciary.

220.title: Taiwan announces death of giant panda gifted by China in 2008
220.article_body: A giant male panda gifted by China to Taiwan in 2008 died on Saturday after suffering a spate of seizures, Taipei Zoo said. Tuan Tuan and his mate, Yuan Yuan, were gifted when relations between the two were more cordial. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

221.title: Being promoted as captain of PBKS is motivation for him: Kaif on Dhawan
221.article_body: Sharing his views on PBKS' decision to appoint Shikhar Dhawan as captain for IPL 2023, Mohammad Kaif said, "It's good that he has been given that responsibility and respect." He added, "Being promoted as captain of Punjab will be a motivation for Dhawan at this stage in his career."  The 36-year-old replaced Mayank Agarwal as captain.

222.title: Hyd man kills 2 puppies, films act and posts videos on social media; held
222.article_body: Police have arrested a Hyderabad man for allegedly killing two puppies and uploading videos on social media after filming the incidents. The incidents came to light when he uploaded the videos on Instagram from an ID identified as Ray. A complaint regarding the same was filed on November 18. The complaint alleged that the accused was a drug addict.

223.title: San Francisco to host APEC summit in 2023: US VP Kamala Harris
223.article_body: US' San Francisco city will host the leaders' meeting of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum next year, US Vice President Kamala Harris said. "Our host year will demonstrate the enduring economic commitment of the US to the Indo-Pacific," Harris, who's leading the US delegation at this year's summit in Bangkok, added. The summit will take place in November, 2023.

224.title: Yatra Online gets SEBI's approval to float IPO
224.article_body: Yatra Online Inc's Indian subsidiary Yatra Online Limited has received SEBI's approval to float an IPO. The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of equity shares worth nearly ₹750 crore by Yatra India and an offer-for-sale of up to 93,28,358 equity shares. THCL Travel Holding Cyprus Limited and Pandara Trust Scheme I through its trustee Vistra ITCL would offload shares.

225.title: Mumbai businessman cheated of ₹30 lakh in loan fraud, case filed
225.article_body: A Mumbai-based businessman, Pritesh Kumar Shaha, was allegedly cheated of ₹30 lakh by two persons on the pretext of helping him secure a loan. Shaha, who runs a steel trading firm, needed a loan to expand his business. Shaha met the accused in 2017, who demanded ₹1 crore to start the loan process, but Shaha paid ₹30 lakh, police said.

226.title: Bengaluru will be India's 'economic capital' in 5 years: Basavaraj Bommai
226.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai asserted that Bengaluru will be India’s 'economic capital' in the next five years. "Karnataka has always been in the top position in attracting foreign investments and startups. The investors and entrepreneurs are now eyeing places around Bengaluru. The state also maintains a good ranking in the fields of agriculture, technology and economy," said Bommai.

227.title: Wedding reception of interfaith couple allegedly cancelled after protests in Mumbai
227.article_body: The wedding reception of an interfaith couple was allegedly cancelled in Mumbai's Vasai after protests by a group. The hall owner reportedly refused to allow the reception after receiving multiple calls. According to the police, neither the couple nor the hall owner has filed any complaint. 'If we receive a complaint, we will take appropriate action," the police added.

228.title: NGT orders realtor to pay ₹10 cr for illegally cutting 500 trees in Faridabad
228.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered a Hyderabad-based real estate developer to pay a compensation of ₹10 crore for illegally felling over 500 trees on five acres of protected forest land in Faridabad. Besides the compensation and the liability to restore the forest land, the company will also be required to do afforestation to the extent of ten times.

229.title: GHMC Mayor launches mobile labs to run quality checks on food
229.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) along with Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) launched mobile labs called 'Food Safety on Wheels' to run quality checks on food. One such unit was launched by Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal. "Four food safety officers and one laboratory technician will be in the vehicle...to check the quality of food," Gadwal said.

230.title: If Anupamaa is on-air, my son covers his face & leaves: Rupali
230.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said in an interview that her son Rudransh does not watch her show 'Anupamaa'. "He enters a room, if Anupamaa is on-air, he covers his face and leaves," she added. "Initially, [he] thought...Anupamaa is my second family and that's why his mumma doesn't spend time with him a lot...I think he misses our time together," said Rupali.

231.title: TDP chief loses cool, calls protesters 'rascals, unworthy people'
231.article_body: During a rally in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu lost his cool and hurled abuses at protesters, calling them "dumb rascals", "unworthy people" and "heinous criminals". A video of the incident has surfaced in which he was also heard asking his supporters to "catch that thief and bring him to me".

232.title: Who are the notable absentees from 2022 FIFA World Cup?
232.article_body: Among notable absentees from 2022 FIFA World Cup is Norwegian striker Erling Haaland, the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing Premier League season. Mohamed Salah will also miss the tournament as Egypt failed to qualify. France's Paul Pogba, N'Golo Kante and Christopher Nkunku will miss the tournament due to injuries. Other absentees include Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Diogo Jota and Sadio Mane.

233.title: This one-sided moral lesson is hypocrisy: FIFA chief on criticism of Qatar World Cup
233.article_body: FIFA chief Gianni Infantino has hit back at Western critics of the World Cup 2022 in Qatar, due to begin tomorrow, saying, "I have difficulties understanding the criticism." Infantino said, "This one-sided moral lesson is just hypocrisy. I wonder why no one recognises the progress made here since 2016." There have been concerns about Qatari policies towards the LGBTQI community.

234.title: It's an opportunity to get our religion globally out there: Kriti on Adipurush
234.article_body: Kriti Sanon has said it is important for the makers of 'Adipurush' to take their time in making it perfect as it needs to be put out in the right way. The actress, who's playing Sita in the film, added, "We all want to give it the best shot because this is...opportunity to get our history...our religion globally out there."

235.title: India played essential role in negotiating G20 declaration: US
235.article_body: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre on Saturday said India played an essential role in negotiating the G-20 Summit declaration. She added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi "made it clear that today's era must not be of war". "Prime Minister Modi's relationship was critical to this outcome, and we look forward to supporting India's G20 presidency next year," Jean-Pierre said.

236.title: Navy man's 8-month pregnant wife mowed down by military bus in Chennai
236.article_body: A military bus mowed down an eight-month pregnant woman, who was wife of a Navy man, in Chennai on Friday night. The two of them were returning from Marina Beach when the accident took place. Reports suggest that the bus accidentally ran over her after the victim's husband lost control of his motorcycle and the couple fell on the road.

237.title: Manika creates history, becomes first Indian woman TT player to win a medal at Asian Cup
237.article_body: Manika Batra on Saturday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian woman table tennis player to win a medal at Asian Cup. The 27-year-old defeated world number six and three-time Asian champion Hina Hayata of Japan 4-2 in the bronze medal match. Manika won the match with a scoreline of 11-6, 6-11, 11-7, 12-10, 4-11, 11-2.

238.title: 274 arms licences suspended in Patiala after Punjab govt's order
238.article_body: Patiala district administration has suspended 274 arms licences after Punjab government ordered a review of arms licences within the next three months and banned public display of firearms and songs allegedly promoting gun culture. Deputy Commissioner Sakshi Sawhney said the action was taken for possessing more than two weapons per licence. Show-cause notices have also been served to the owners.

239.title: Delhi-Meerut rapid metro trials to start in December in Ghaziabad
239.article_body: The trial run on the 17-kilometre-long priority stretch of the Delhi-Meerut rapid metro will start in December in Ghaziabad. It is expected to get operationalised by March next year. The priority stretch will run from Sahibabad to Duhai through Guldhar. It is a part of the 82.15 km line that will connect Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut.

240.title: India could become net exporter of green energy by 2050: Gautam Adani
240.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said the combination of solar and green power, along with green hydrogen would open up "great" opportunities for the future. "By 2050, there is potential for India to become a net exporter of green energy," Adani said. He also reiterated that India would become the third-largest economy "well before" 2030 and the second-largest by 2050.

241.title: Kasturba college students fell ill due to stench from garbage: Hyd Police
241.article_body: Hyderabad Police said around 50 students of Secunderabad's Kasturba Gandhi Junior College for Women fell ill on Friday due to a foul smell emanating from garbage. DCP Chandana Deepti said garbage was being lifted from a nearby spot when students complained of breathlessness and vomiting sensation. Earlier, it was reported that students fell ill after gas leak in science laboratory.

242.title: Indian paddler Manika Batra loses in semis of Asian Cup
242.article_body: Table tennis player Manika Batra, who became the first Indian woman to reach the semi-final of Asian Cup, lost to world number five Mima Ito of Japan 8-11, 11-7, 7-11, 6-11, 11-8, 7-11 in Bangkok on Saturday. With this, the Indian campaign ended at the tournament. Earlier, Sharath Kamal and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost in the first round of men's singles.

243.title: Air India will increase its market share to around 30% on all routes: CEO
243.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson announced the company will increase its market share to around 30% on domestic as well as international routes. He added Air India will be introducing premium economy class in some of its long haul international flights next month. The airline has finalised leases for 30 additional aircraft being delivered over next 12 months, Wilson stated.

244.title: Class 9 student brings toy air gun to Punjab school, causes panic
244.article_body: A Class 9 student was found carrying a toy air gun in his bag in a school in Punjab's Dera Bassi that led to panic. The students who saw the gun believed it to be real and informed the teacher, following which the school principal called the police. The police reached the school and seized the toy gun.

245.title: Camera on-board India's 1st private rocket captures its liftoff, video released
245.article_body: Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace has released a video of the liftoff of their Vikram-S rocket that was launched from ISRO's Sriharikota launch pad on November 18 (Friday). The video captured by the camera onboard the rocket shows a view of the Earth as the rocket takes off. The rocket's launch was hailed as a 'new milestone' for independent India.

246.title: It's humbling: Zepto Founder on making it to Hurun India Rich List
246.article_body:
When asked about featuring as the youngest entrants to the Hurun India Rich List 2022, grocery delivery startup Zepto Founders Kaivalya Vohra and Aadit Palicha said it was humbling.
"It's humbling, but honestly, it's not something we end up thinking about every day, because there's always a bunch of stuff going on with the business," Kaivalya said at TechSparks 2022.

247.title: 39-year-old RPF constable dies after being hit by train in Mumbai
247.article_body: A 39-year-old Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable died in a train accident near Borivali Railway Station in Mumbai on Friday. The incident happened when the deceased, Bharat Kumar Prajapati, was patrolling with his colleague before a local train coming from Churchgate hit him from behind, officials said. Notably, Prajapati was a native of Gujarat's Palanpur.

248.title: PM Modi given similar immunity in 2014: US on immunity to Saudi Crown Prince
248.article_body: Speaking about immunity from prosecution afforded to Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman over journalist Jamal Khashoggi's killing, US said such immunity has been applied to several heads of state. "Some examples: President Aristide in Haiti in 1993...PM Modi in India in 2014," spokesperson Vedant Patel said. US had placed PM Modi on visa ban in 2005 over Godhra riots.

249.title: Pak to appoint new Army chief in 2 days: Interior Minister
249.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah on Friday said that Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif would be appointing the country's next Army chief in a "day or two". Any further delay in the appointment would not be appropriate, Sanaullah added. Pakistan's current Chief of Army Staff General Qamar Javed Bajwa's tenure will end on November 29.

250.title: Sport is cruel sometimes, I had a few tears: England's Malan on missing T20 WC 2022 final
250.article_body: England batter Dawid Malan revealed he cried after being informed he'd miss T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. He added, "Not being able to play...final was probably one of the toughest days I've ever had as a cricketer...[Sport is] cruel sometimes." Malan stated, "You never know how many World Cup finals you're going to be a part of."

251.title: How much prize money will 2022 FIFA World Cup winners get?
251.article_body: The winners of 2022 FIFA World Cup will get a prize money of $42 million. The runners-up will receive $30 million. The team finishing third in the tournament will get a prize money of $27 million, while the fourth-placed team will get $25 million. Further, teams finishing fifth to eighth will get $17 million each.

252.title: Suvendu gets notice from child rights body for 'offensive' tweet
252.article_body: West Bengal Commission for Protection of Child Rights (WBCPCR) sent a show-cause notice to BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari for an alleged offensive tweet mentioning TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee's three-year-old son. "Grand celebrations tonight at Taj Bengal! Security has been beefed up for the birthday party of Koyla Bhaipo's son," Adhikari had tweeted.

253.title: Musk starts unbanning Twitter accounts, announces new hate speech policy
253.article_body: Elon Musk has announced that Twitter accounts of Kathy Griffin, Jordan Peterson and Babylon Bee have been reinstated. He also announced a new policy on hate speech, writing, "Negative/hate tweets will be max deboosted and demonetised...so no ads or other revenue to Twitter...You won't find the tweet unless you specifically seek it out."

254.title: Last time Trump was on Twitter, US VP was nearly killed: AOC on Musk's poll
254.article_body: Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) responded to Elon Musk's Twitter poll on reinstating former President Donald Trump's account saying that the last time Trump was on Twitter, the Vice President of the US was "nearly assassinated". "Last time he was here this platform was used to incite an insurrection, multiple people died...and hundreds were injured," she added.

255.title: Spanish Police seizes record 52 tonnes of marijuana
255.article_body: Spanish police said they've seized around 52 tonnes of marijuana, the largest amount of the drug ever seized in the country and weighing more than an adult humpback whale. Eight farms were dismantled in the four-phase operation in the northeastern region of Catalonia, police added, saying, 20 people have been detained for suspected electricity fraud and offences against public health.

256.title: Nehru made contributions towards development, India is his land: Raut
256.article_body: A day after warning Congress of a rift in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance, MP Sanjay Raut praised India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru and said that India is his land. "[He has] made a lot of contributions towards the development of the country...The whole country has respect and faith for [freedom fighters]," said Raut.

257.title: Zomato begins layoffs, at least 100 employees already impacted: Report
257.article_body: Zomato has started laying off employees in a bid to cut costs and turn profitable, Moneycontrol reported. At least 100 employees have already been impacted across functions such as product, tech, catalogue and marketing, the report said, adding that Zomato plans to lay off at least 4% of its workforce. Notably, Zomato Co-founder Mohit Gupta announced his resignation on Friday.

258.title: Musk says conspiracy theorist Alex Jones won't be allowed back on Twitter
258.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk in response to a user asking for conspiracy theorist Alex Jones to be brought back on Twitter, said, "No." Reacting to Musk's reply, another user said Jones is the litmus test, not allowing him will lead to Twitter never being any more trustworthy than before. "Too bad," Musk replied.

259.title: Massive fire breaks out at hookah bar in Mumbai; video surfaces
259.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a hookah bar at Revival restaurant in Mumbai in the early hours of Saturday. A video of the fire engulfing the hookah bar has surfaced online. Four fire engines were present at the spot. Some years ago, the hookah bar had been razed after 14 people died in the Kamla Mills fire incident.

260.title: Bus carrying Sabarimala pilgrims overturns in Kerala; 20 injured
260.article_body: Over 20 people were injured, including an eight-year-old boy, after a bus carrying 44 Sabarimala pilgrims from Andhra Pradesh overturned in Kerala's Pathanamthitta on Saturday. All the pilgrims were rescued and shifted to nearby hospitals, district administration officials said. State Health Minister Veena George has reached the accident site and made arrangements for pilgrims' further treatment.

261.title: 2 Gurugram brothers aged 25, 26 killed as motorcycle hits another motorcycle
261.article_body: Two brothers aged 25 and 26 were killed after a motorcycle allegedly hit the motorcycle that they were travelling on in Gurugram.  An eyewitness in the case said that he was returning home and was just behind the brothers' motorcycle. "They both suffered injuries. I rushed them to...private hospital, where they were declared brought dead," the eyewitness said.

262.title: 2 boys assault police in Gr Noida; let go after parents apologise
262.article_body: Two minor boys who allegedly assaulted police personnel in Greater Noida were fined and let go after an apology letter from their parents, police said. The incident occurred after the boys parked their bike in the middle of road, causing traffic congestion, and when police personnel asked them to address this, the duo started a heated argument, according to police.

263.title: Zoho Books reports 81% surge in India revenue in 2021
263.article_body: Zoho Books, a unit of the Chennai-headquartered global technology company Zoho Corporation, witnessed an 81% annual growth in India in 2021. Zoho Finance platform also saw a 50% year-on-year growth globally. Last week, Zoho said that it had clocked a revenue of $1 billion in 2021. Zoho Books is an online accounting service that automates business workflows.

264.title: Twitter staff count down till they're fired for rejecting Musk's ultimatum, video shows
264.article_body: A Twitter employee shared a video purportedly showing him and others counting down the seconds until they were set to be fired for not accepting an ultimatum sent by Elon Musk. Most employees seen in the video said they worked at Twitter for at least nine years. Musk asked Twitter staff to commit to "hardcore" version of Twitter or resign.

265.title: Dozens of sheep walk in a circle for 12 days straight in China; video goes viral
265.article_body: Dozens of sheep were seen moving in a circle for twelve consecutive days in northern China, a video of which is going viral on social media. The flock can be seen moving in a clockwise pattern. "The sheep are healthy and the reason for the weird behavior is still a mystery," Chinese state-run media reported.

266.title: AOC says Twitter workers 'deserved so much better', Musk replies
266.article_body: Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) thanked the social media platform's workers on Friday. "Shout out to all the workers at Twitter. You all built a vital place for connection and deserved so much better. Millions of people appreciate the space you built and the hard work that went into it," she added. Replying to Cortez, Elon Musk said, "You're welcome."

267.title: China asks CCP members, military veterans to help Foxconn amid labour issue
267.article_body: The Chinese government has asked the Communist Party members, civil servants and military veterans to help out iPhone-maker Foxconn amid a labour shortage at its factory in Zhengzhou, the NYT reported citing county notices and state media reports. Local government authorities are also recruiting workers from villages and transporting them directly to the Foxconn plant after quarantining them.

268.title: Indian economy to grow up to 6.3% in Q2 of this fiscal: RBI
268.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday said that the Indian economy is expected to record growth between 6.1%-6.3% in the second quarter of the current financial year. In its monetary policy statement, the RBI had estimated gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 6.3% in Q2, 4.6% in Q3 and Q4 each, with 7% growth in FY23.

269.title: 30 get life term for burning SHO alive in 2011 communal riots in Raj
269.article_body: A special court in Sawai Madhopur district of Rajasthan sentenced 30 persons to life imprisonment with a fine for murdering Phool Mohammad Khan, then SHO of Mantown police station in 2011. Khan had taken refuge inside his police vehicle during communal riots in the area but a mob burnt the vehicle. Out of 79 facing trial, the court convicted 30.

270.title: Rublev defeats world no. 3 Tsitsipas to join Djokovic in ATP Finals' last-4
270.article_body: Russian tennis player Andrey Rublev defeated world number three Stefanos Tsitsipas to reach the last four of the ATP Finals for the first time. Rublev won with a scoreline of 3-6, 6-3, 6-2. He will face Casper Ruud in the semi-final. Earlier, Novak Djokovic defeated Daniil Medvedev to reach the semi-finals, where he'll face Taylor Fritz.

271.title: Pune businessman's body found in Audi parked on Mumbai-Goa highway
271.article_body: The body of a 44-year-old businessman was found inside an Audi car on the Mumbai-Goa highway on Friday. The deceased was identified as Sanjay Karle, who ran a water supply tanker business. "Injury mark found on chest could be a stab mark or bullet wound," a police officer said. Police claimed criminal cases were filed against Karle in the past.

272.title: Aftabs will emerge in every city if country doesn't have strong leader: Assam CM
272.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma reacted to the murder of Shraddha Walkar allegedly by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, saying, "If...the country doesn't have a strong leader, a government that respects nation as a mother, such Aftabs will emerge in every city." He added that in such a situation, "we will not be able to safeguard our society".

273.title: Tesla stock hits near two-year-low after it recalls 30,000 Model X cars
273.article_body: Tesla shares fell 3% on Friday to their lowest in nearly two years after the EV maker recalled 30,000 Model X cars over a front passenger airbag issue. The issue is causing the front passenger airbag to deploy incorrectly in certain low-speed collision events. Tesla said it is not aware of any crashes, injuries or deaths related to the recall.

274.title: I'd love to see woman in woman power: Jaya on females wearing western clothes
274.article_body: Actress Jaya Bachchan said that she feels we have unknowingly accepted that western clothing gives man-power to a woman. "I would love to see a woman in woman power. I am not saying, 'Go wear saree'. But in the West also, women used to dress in dresses. This whole thing changed much later when they started wearing pants," she added.

275.title: Watch on Twitter: Musk on 'Where to watch first World Cup match' query
275.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk answered the search query, 'Where to watch first World Cup match?' by tweeting, "First World Cup match on Sunday! Watch on Twitter for best coverage & real-time commentary." Though Musk didn't specify which sport he was talking about, in all probability, he was referring to the FIFA World Cup 2022, which will start on November 20.

276.title: IAS officer shares video of elephant eating plastic, says 'tragedy beyond measure'
276.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu has shared a video of an elephant chewing a plastic bag after picking it up from ground. "When humans become slaves of throwaway plastic the price is paid by wild animals. Its a tragedy beyond measure," Sahu tweeted with the video. Several people reacted to the video, with one user saying, "This is horrible."

277.title: 22-year-old Pune man dies after his bike crashes into divider
277.article_body: A 22-year-old man from Pune died after his bike crashed into the divider near a petrol pump on the Mumbai-Goa highway on Friday, the police said. The deceased was heading towards Goa for an event when the incident took place, according to the police. The man was taken to a hospital, however, he succumbed to his injuries.

278.title: Two kids drown in sea off Mumbai coast, three rescued
278.article_body: Two children drowned and three were rescued by locals after they ventured into the sea in the Worli area of central Mumbai at around 3:15 pm on Friday. "The water level had increased in the afternoon and [the] children miscalculated the risk involved…They were bobbing in the water and drifting further deep into the sea," said a local resident.

279.title: Delhi Police questions Shraddha's friend who alerted her father
279.article_body: A two-member team of Delhi Police on Friday questioned Lakshman Nadar, believed to be a close friend of deceased Shraddha Walkar, who was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Amin Poonawala. Nadar was questioned in Vasai, Maharashtra. He had alerted Shraddha's father that her phone was switched off for months, following which a missing person's complaint was lodged.

280.title: Drunk man rams SUV into 14 vehicles in Gurugram; woman injured
280.article_body: A woman was critically injured after a man, who was in an inebriated state, rammed his SUV into at least 14 vehicles in the Housing Board Colony in Gurugram's Sector 39. The SUV driver "wasn't even able to open his eyes", according to eyewitness statements to police. The woman's brother said that she was "dragged by...SUV for a few metres".

281.title: Jain was getting physiotherapy due to injury: AAP on massage in Tihar videos
281.article_body: AAP minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday said his colleague Satyendar Jain was getting physiotherapy inside the Tihar jail due to a spinal injury. His clarification came after multiple videos emerged from Tihar jail showing Jain getting massages. "BJP is making fun of his illness," Sisodia said. He also claimed that ED was instructed by the court to not leak videos.

282.title: US VP Harris briefly meets China's Xi, calls for 'open lines of communication'
282.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris on Saturday briefly met with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the APEC summit in Thailand. Harris stressed the need to maintain open lines of communication to responsibly manage competition between the US and China, reiterating a message delivered by President Joe Biden in an earlier meeting with the Chinese leader, a White House official said.

283.title: Private tuitions by govt teachers banned in J&K
283.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration issued a circular prohibiting government teachers from taking private tuitions. "No teaching faculty shall undertake any activity or assignment, including teaching in private educational institutions or coaching centres, unless they obtain prior sanction from the competent authority," said the circular. It warned of disciplinary action against violators.

284.title: Pant can go gung-ho in powerplay, can be given opportunity to open: Karthik
284.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has admitted that the management is trying to figure out Rishabh Pant's place in the playing XI in the T20Is. Karthik, however, also added that Pant can be given the opportunity to open for the side in the future. "Pant can go gung-ho in the powerplay...Interestingly, his strike rate is highest when he opens," added Karthik.

285.title: Sonia, Rahul Gandhi pay tribute to Indira Gandhi on her birth anniversary
285.article_body: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge and MP Rahul Gandhi paid floral tribute to former PM Indira Gandhi on her birth anniversary. The Congress announced that only women will walk with Rahul Gandhi during the Bharat Jodo Yatra today. The women workers will participate in both the sessions (pre-lunch and post-lunch) of the yatra, which is in Maharashtra.

286.title: 10 killed as gang leaders' transfer sparks prison riot in Ecuador
286.article_body: At least 10 people were killed in a riot at a prison in Ecuador's capital Quito on Friday, the prisons agency said. The riot took place after authorities moved two gang leaders to a maximum security facility. Ecuador has experienced eight prison riots that have left about 400 inmates dead since 2021, with many of the victims beheaded or burnt.

287.title: Time to honour Gandhi's wish, immerse Cong in Narmada: Yogi in Guj
287.article_body: Campaigning for Gujarat elections, UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said it was time to "honour Mahatma Gandhi's desire of dissolving the Congress after independence" and "immerse the party in the Narmada". "What's the point in supporting a party that can't respect your faith, be part of your joys and sorrows and prefers terrorism to nationalism," he added.

288.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Rani Lakshmibai, says 'She is source of inspiration'
288.article_body: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to the freedom fighter Rani Lakshmibai on the occasion of her birth anniversary and said that her courage and monumental contribution to the nation can never be forgotten. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "Remembering Rani Lakshmibai on her Jayanti…She is a source of inspiration for her steadfast opposition to colonial rule."

289.title: Export tax on low-grade iron ore, some steel products removed
289.article_body: The government has removed an export tax levied on low-grade iron ore lumps and fines with below 58% iron content. This move reverses an earlier order from May when it had raised the tax to 50%. The government also scrapped the export tax on some steel intermediates from 15%, which was also imposed in May.

290.title: India to have split captaincy, Hardik likely to become full-time T20I captain: Reports
290.article_body: Team India will have split captaincy after a new selection committee is appointed by BCCI, as per reports. The new panel will have to "appoint captain for the team in each format", as per the job criteria. Hardik Pandya will likely replace Rohit Sharma as India's full-time T20I captain, while Rohit will continue leading in the longer formats, reports added.

291.title: Most copycat founders skipping firing themselves and copying layoffs: Ashneer
291.article_body: Entrepreneur Ashneer Grover on Saturday tweeted that most "copycat Founders" are skipping the hard part of firing themselves or getting bought over and conveniently copying layoffs. Referring to Elon Musk and Twitter saga, Grover wrote, "First Elon Musk took over company, fired incompetent management and then did layoffs in a bloated organisation...What works in M&A just does not otherwise!"

292.title: 19-yr-old model gangraped inside moving car in Kerala; 4 including another model held
292.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including a woman, after a 19-year-old model was allegedly gangraped inside a moving car in Kerala's Kochi. The arrested woman is also a model by profession, police said. The accused woman had invited the 19-year-old to a party and introduced her to the three accused men who allegedly raped her after she got drunk.

293.title: VVIP mazaa instead of sazaa: Shehzad on Satyendar getting massage in jail
293.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Satyendar Jain is getting VVIP mazaa instead of sazaa inside Tihar Jail. This comes after a video of Jain getting a massage inside jail surfaced online. "Hawalabaaz who hasn't got bail for 5 months gets a head massage...This is how the official position was abused for Vasooli," he wrote.

294.title: Need order even to search house: HC to Assam Police for using bulldozer
294.article_body: The Gauhati High Court recently remarked that the police can't even search someone's house without the court's permission. Chief Justice RM Chhaya pulled up Assam Police for demolishing the house of an accused in an arson case. "Even if a..serious matter is being investigated by an agency, bulldozing of a house is not provided under any criminal law," he said.

295.title: NASA awards SpaceX 2nd contract option for Artemis worth $1.15 bn
295.article_body: NASA has awarded a contract modification to SpaceX to further develop its Starship system under which SpaceX will provide a second crewed landing demonstration mission in 2027 as part of NASA's Artemis IV mission. The contract modification is worth $1.15 billion. SpaceX needs to develop and demonstrate a Starship lander that meets NASA's sustaining requirements for missions beyond Artemis III.

296.title: Complete Pune's Garware college-Civil Court metro line by Jan 26: Patil
296.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil has directed officials of Maha-Metro to complete the work for the metro line between Garware college and Civil Court in Pune by January 26 next year. Moreover, he said that the work of the 33 km metro line should be planned in such a manner that it's done by the end of March next year.

297.title: America wasn't ready for my natural hair: Ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama
297.article_body: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama said Americans "weren't ready" for her natural hair when her husband Barack Obama was elected as President. Michelle added that she'd straightened her hair so people could adjust to having a Black family in the White House. She made these comments while promoting her new book 'The Light We Carry: Overcoming in Uncertain Times'.

298.title: Will shoot anyone who grabs my workers' collars: Rebel Guj BJP leader
298.article_body: Denied a BJP ticket in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, 70-year-old rebel BJP leader Madhu Shrivastav on Thursday warned, "If somebody grabs my workers' collars, I will go to their house and shoot them." He made the statement while addressing a rally before filing nomination as an independent candidate from the Vaghodia seat.

299.title: If there's cricket match in Guwahati, Rahul will carry bat to Guj: Assam CM
299.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that if there is a cricket match in Guwahati, Rahul Gandhi will be in Gujarat. "Rahul Gandhi has a habit that I've been observing for days...he'll keep getting ready but won't come to the field," Sarma added. While speaking about Rahul's comment on Veer Savarkar, Sarma said Gandhi has very little historical knowledge.

300.title: PM Modi inaugurates Arunachal's 1st greenfield airport in Itanagar
300.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated Arunachal Pradesh's first greenfield airport, Donyi Polo Airport, in Itanagar. The airport has been built at the cost of over ₹640 crore. According to a statement by the PM's Office, the airport's name reflects the state's traditions and rich cultural heritage and its "age-old indigenous reverence to the Sun ('Donyi') and the Moon ('Polo')".

301.title: If possible, fly to San Francisco: Musk to Twitter engineers amid mass exits
301.article_body: Elon Musk on Friday urged Twitter engineers to "fly to San Francisco to be present in person" at the company headquarters if possible, after hundreds of employees resigned. Musk told employees he would be at the office until midnight and would return Saturday morning, Reuters reported. He earlier asked all coders to report to the 10th floor of Twitter's headquarters.

302.title: 2 Bengaluru college students booked for shouting 'Pakistan Zindabad'
302.article_body: Two engineering students, a boy and a girl, were detained and a case was filed against them after they allegedly raised pro-Pakistan slogans at a college event in Bengaluru. The two were reportedly seen shouting "Pakistan Zindabad" in a video that has surfaced. The incident took place at New Horizon College of Engineering on Thursday.

303.title: RCB close to winning IPL, haven't changed squad too much: Manjrekar
303.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said RCB, who had "one of their better seasons" in the last edition, are close to winning their maiden IPL title. "I expect them to really do well [in IPL 2023]," added Manjrekar. Notably, RCB released five players as part of their retention process and have ₹8.75 crores remaining for the mini-auction on December 23.

304.title: Customer gets ₹1.3 crore bill at chef Salt Bae's UAE restaurant; pic viral
304.article_body: Turkish celebrity chef Nusr-Et Gokce, famously known as 'Salt Bae', has shared a picture of a customer's AED 615,065 (around ₹1.3 crore) bill at his restaurant in UAE's Abu Dhabi. "Quality never expensive," he wrote with the picture of the bill on Instagram. A value added tax (VAT) of around ₹6.5 lakh was levied on their bill.

305.title: US climate envoy John Kerry tests positive for COVID-19 at COP27
305.article_body: US Special Climate Envoy John Kerry has tested positive for COVID-19 at the COP27 climate summit in Egypt, the US State Department said on Friday. "He is working with his negotiations team and foreign counterparts by phone to ensure a successful outcome of COP27," US State Department spokesperson Whitney Smith said. Kerry is fully vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19.

306.title: Gurugram records season's coldest day on Friday, temperature drops to 8°C
306.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department, Gurugram recorded the lowest temperature this season at 8 degrees Celsius on Friday. It was also the lowest temperature recorded across Haryana on Friday. "Dip in the temperature is normal. It will continue to drop by one to two degrees Celsius every four to five days [until] January," said the Director of IMD, Chandigarh.

307.title: FTX fires 3 top execs including Co-founder Gary Wang: Report
307.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX has fired three of its top executives, including Co-founder Gary Wang, The Wall Street Journal reported citing an FTX spokeswoman. Director of Engineering Nishad Singh and Caroline Ellison, who ran FTX's trading arm Alameda Research, were also fired. FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried filed for bankruptcy protection in the US last week and also resigned as CEO.

308.title: Video allegedly shows Delhi minister Satyendar getting massage inside Tihar
308.article_body: A video surfaced on Saturday allegedly showing Delhi minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain getting a massage inside the Tihar jail where he is currently lodged. He was arrested in May for his alleged involvement in a money laundering case. Notably, earlier this month, the Tihar jail superintendent was also suspended over the alleged VIP treatment given to Jain.

309.title: HC directs YouTube to remove content against Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin
309.article_body: Calcutta High Court has directed YouTube to delete all "personal, defamatory and derogatory comments" against cricketer Mohammad Shami's estranged wife, Hasin Jahan, from its platform. Jahan had moved the court in 2019 and claimed that she and her minor daughter were been subjected to intimidation, threat and trolling on the platform due to her ongoing legal battle with the cricketer.

310.title: Protesters set fire to Iran's ex-Supreme leader Khomeini’s ancestral home
310.article_body: Protestors in Iran set fire to the ancestral home of the founder of the Islamic Republic, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, as protests ignited by 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death entered the third month. Ayatollah Khomeini is said to have been born in the house, which had been converted into a museum. Social media videos showed people cheering as the fire broke out.

311.title: Everyone needed it: Ashwin on Shastri's remark over Dravid's NZ tour break
311.article_body: Reacting to Ravi Shastri questioning Team India management over current coach Rahul Dravid being rested for the New Zealand tour, Ravichandran Ashwin said everyone needed a break after the 2022 T20 WC. "[The coaching staff] had specific in-depth plans for each venue and each opposition. So they would have been under not only mental but also physical burnout," he explained.

312.title: SIT summons BJP leader BL Santhosh in TRS MLAs poaching case
312.article_body: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) of the Telangana police has summoned BJP National General Secretary (Organisation) BL Santhosh in connection with the case related to the alleged poaching of TRS MLAs into the BJP. Santhosh has been asked to appear before an investigating officer on November 21, failing which he will be liable for arrest, according to the SIT's notice.

313.title: Tata Motors to replace Dr Reddy's in Sensex from December 19
313.article_body: Tata Motors will replace Dr Reddy's Laboratories in the 30-share Sensex index from December 19, Asia Index Private Limited announced on Friday. The rejig is part of a periodic reshuffle done in the 30-share index. From S&P BSE 100 index, stocks of Adani Total Gas and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation will be replaced by Adani Power and Indian Hotels Company.

314.title: People memorised it but I've forgotten it: Shehnaaz on famous 'Tommy' dialogue
314.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said people have memorised her famous 'Tuada kutta Tommy' dialogue by heart but she has forgotten it because she wants to do something different now. According to The Indian Express, she said she has finally become a big celebrity now. The dialogue had become famous after music composer Yashraj Mukhate had created a unique version of it.

315.title: Nobody safe if it is allowed: HC after Assam Police bulldoze houses
315.article_body: The Gauhati High Court criticised Assam Police for demolishing houses of five people using bulldozers in Nagaon district in May. The police action came after a mob torched a police station over an alleged custodial death of a fish seller. "Nobody is safe in this country if that is permitted. Procedure has to be followed," said the court.

316.title: Entry will be free for all at ASI-protected monuments today: ASI
316.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has tweeted that entry will be free for all at ASI-protected monuments, including the Taj Mahal in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, today to mark the commencement of World Heritage Week. However, the ASI added that people will only be allowed to visit the main Mausoleum at the Taj Mahal with a requisite entry ticket.

317.title: Pantaloons offers ‘Buy 3 @ 50%*’ off during Mid Season Sale
317.article_body: Pantaloons announced that with its ongoing Mid Season Sale, customers can avail 'Buy 3 @ 50%*' off deal till November 23. The brand aims to take the style quotient a notch above with their fashionable outfits. The offer is available on wide range of categories like t-shirts, dresses, bags & more, on select exclusive brands at your nearest Pantaloons store.

318.title: Decided to stay with trans people, was with 20-25 of them: Nawazuddin on Haddi
318.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he decided to stay with trans people while preparing for his role in 'Haddi'. "I'm working with a lot of trans-people in Haddi. I was in an environment with 20-25 of them. Their way of looking at the world is completely different. That was really interesting. I learned so much about their journeys," he added.

319.title: Google cancels talk by India-born author after staff complain in US, he responds
319.article_body: Google cancelled a talk by India-born author Rajiv Malhotra after some employees complained to management about him, Reuters reported. Malhotra described homosexuality as a medical condition and Islam as a destructive force, a document by Alphabet Workers Union noted. Malhotra responded saying he supports marginalised communities but opposes "politicising of bias in ways that divide societies".

320.title: Hyd Police books 8 persons for vandalising BJP MP's house
320.article_body: The Hyderabad Police has booked eight persons in connection with the attack at the house of BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri on Friday. They have been booked under non-bailable sections. Meanwhile, Telangana Governor also sought a report from the state DGP on the attack. She said the attack was highly condemnable and there is no place for violence in democracy.

321.title: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Vaze granted bail in money laundering case
321.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Vaze has been granted bail in the money laundering case registered against ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. However, he will not walk out of prison as he is facing prosecution in two other cases involving the NIA and CBI. While granting bail, the court observed that Vaze has always cooperated in the probe.

322.title: He's 'chhichora' kind of person, will beat him with slippers: TRS MLC on BJP MP
322.article_body: TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla, who is also the daughter of Telangana CM KCR, on Friday criticised BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri saying he is a 'chhichora' kind of person. "I will beat him with slippers in the heart of Nizamabad town. I am sorry to say this," she added. Kavitha was speaking to the media about vandalism at Dharmapuri's Hyderabad house.

323.title: Plane carrying 102 people hits truck during takeoff, catches fire in Peru; video surfaces
323.article_body: Two firefighters were killed on Friday at an airport in Peru when a LATAM airline passenger plane hit a firetruck during takeoff and caught fire on the runway, officials said. The airline said 102 passengers were onboard the plane, adding that no passengers or crew members lost their lives. Several passengers were taken to nearby hospitals.

324.title: Russian strikes has disabled nearly half of Ukraine's power grid: PM Denys
324.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal said that Russian missile strikes have crippled almost half of Ukraine's energy system. This comes as temperatures drop below freezing and the capital Kyiv experiences its first snow. According to Ukraine's national grid operator, Ukrenergo, Russia had launched six large-scale missile attacks on the country's energy infrastructure between October 10 and November 15.

325.title: Elon Musk fires Twitter ad executive days after convincing her to stay: Report
325.article_body: Elon Musk is said to have fired Twitter's head of ad sales Robin Wheeler. The move comes days after the billionaire reportedly tried to convince Wheeler not to resign from her post. Shortly after reports of her exit, Wheeler tweeted on Friday, "To the team and my clients...you were always my first and only priority," followed by a salute emoji.

326.title: California-based robot delivery startup Nuro lays off 300 workers
326.article_body: California-based autonomous delivery startup Nuro has laid off around 300 employees, representing about 20% of its workforce. "We doubled the size of our team in less than two years...assuming the funding environment would remain strong. This was a mistake," Nuro's co-founders said. The startup raised $600 million a year ago that increased its valuation to about $8.6 billion.

327.title: Ironic how people say 'Twitter is dead', on Twitter: Binance CEO
327.article_body: As '#RIPTwitter' trended on Twitter amid reports of mass resignations, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao posted, "Ironic how people say "Twitter is dead", on Twitter." The resignations came after Elon Musk gave an ultimatum to employees to sign up for "long hours at high intensity", or leave. Binance had invested $500 million in Musk's $44 billion deal to buy Twitter.

328.title: SC dismisses pleas seeking to enforce two-child norm
328.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a batch of petitions seeking to enforce a two-child norm to control population in the country. The two-judge bench said that the issue is for the government to look at and the court should not interfere. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had dismissed a plea seeking steps, including a two-child norm, for population control.

329.title: Byculla zoo opens online ticket service, bottle crusher machines being put up
329.article_body: The Byculla Zoo in Mumbai has opened up online ticket services for its customers. Citizens will now be able to book tickets using a web link, reports said. Further, according to reports, the BMC is also installing plastic bottle crusher machines inside the premises of the zoo. The machines are being installed under the CSR programme.

330.title: Delhi pvt unaided schools can charge over 5 paise/day as late payment fee: HC
330.article_body: Delhi High Court has allowed private unaided schools in the national capital to charge over five paise/day for late payment of fees after 10th of every month. It's "inconsistent" to suggest these schools are free to levy fees but have to levy five paise/day fine, court said. It added that private unaided schools' fees are higher than aided schools' fees.

331.title: 2 Pune hotels raided for running illegal hookah parlours; 3 booked
331.article_body: Pune's Koregaon Park police has raided two hotels on charges of running illegal hookah parlours. One person was booked following the raid at the first hotel, while two other people were booked for operating beyond the permitted closure time after the second hotel was raided. The police also seized items worth a total of ₹9,300 in both raids.

332.title: Gujarat is riot-free because of PM Narendra Modi: Anurag Thakur
332.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur praised the BJP and PM Narendra Modi for making Gujarat riot-free. He further asserted that the BJP works on the basis of good governance, development and honesty. "The more Gujarat progresses, the more India will progress. If Gujarat wins, then India will progress…Congress did politics only on [the] basis of divide and rule," said Anurag Thakur.

333.title: FTX's Bankman-Fried cashed out $300 mn in 2021 funding round: WSJ
333.article_body: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried received $300 million of $420 million raised by the company in its October 2021 funding round, The Wall Street Journal reported. He reportedly sold some of his personal stake in FTX. He told investors it was partial reimbursement of money he'd spent to buy out Binance's stake in FTX a few months earlier, the report stated.

334.title: US court to decide if Musk's $56-bn salary justifies Tesla growth
334.article_body: After five days of testimony, a Delaware court will now decide if Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56-billion pay package was justified by the company's growth or undermined by a flawed process. Tesla shareholder Richard Tornetta claimed that Musk's 2018 pay package was to subservient directors and approved by a vote of shareholders who were misled by Tesla.

335.title: TSRTC starts AC minibus services from Raidurg Metro Station
335.article_body: Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has decided to run Vajra AC minibus services from Raidurg Metro Station in Hyderabad after receiving multiple requests from the employees working in the IT corridor. Earlier, the employees had to either walk for over two kilometres or pay for a cab at a high rate.

336.title: Parliament's winter session to begin on Dec 7, will last for 23 days
336.article_body: Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi said on Friday that the winter session of Parliament will begin on December 7. "Winter session...will...continue till December 29 having 17 sittings spread over 23 days," he added. "Looking forward to discussions on legislative business and other items during the session," he said.

337.title: Nothing wrong in my Insta post: IAS officer-actor as he's sacked from Guj poll duty
337.article_body: IAS officer-turned-actor Abhishek Singh has reacted after he was relieved of his poll duties in Gujarat elections over his Instagram post announcing his posting. "I accept the Hon'ble ECI's decision with all humility. Though I believe there's nothing wrong in this post...It's neither publicity nor a stunt," he tweeted. The Election Commission reportedly called his post a publicity stunt.

338.title: There is a possibility of another attack on Imran Khan: Pak judge
338.article_body: Citing an intelligence report, the Chief Justice of Islamabad High Court said there's a possibility of another assassination attempt on ex-PM Imran Khan. "It's the responsibility of the government and the state to look into the matter," Chief Justice Aamer Farooq said. Earlier this month, Khan was shot in the leg by an attacker during a rally demanding immediate elections.

339.title: Overhead water tank of transit camp bursts in Mumbai, 2 houses damaged
339.article_body: The overhead water tank of a ground-plus-four-storey transit camp at Gautam Nagar in Mumbai's Dadar burst on Monday. The incident took place around 7 am. Reports said that two homes on the topmost floor of the building were damaged. A resident of the building said that when the tank burst, water surged into his room and the furniture was damaged.

340.title: Musk calls all coders to Twitter headquarters after 1,200 employees resign: Reports
340.article_body: Elon Musk has reportedly sent a company email to the Twitter engineering team asking "anyone who actually writes software" to report to Twitter headquarters in San Francisco by 2 pm (PST) on Friday. This comes after around 1,200 Twitter employees resigned by declining to click 'Yes' on a form Musk sent out requiring employees to commit to working long hours.

341.title: Bengaluru Metro to provide 175 km of connectivity by June 2025: MD
341.article_body: Bengaluru Metro will provide 175 km of connectivity in the city by June 2025, said BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez on Friday. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit 2022, Parwez added that the metro connectivity will reach 314 km by 2041. The construction of metro lines near the airport is progressing well, he further said.

342.title: Italy rejects Google’s appeal against $10 mn fine, accepts Apple’s
342.article_body: An Italian administrative court on Friday rejected an appeal by Google against a $10.36 million fine by Italy's antitrust authority AGCM. However, it accepted Apple's appeal against a similar fine. AGCM fined Google and Apple $10.36 million each last year, claiming that they had not provided "clear and immediate information" on how they collect and use users' data.

343.title: Mumbai man looking to check PF balance loses ₹1.23 lakh in 14 transactions
343.article_body: A 47-year-old man lost ₹1.23 lakh in 14 different transactions while he was allegedly looking for EPFO's helpline number to check his PF balance in Mumbai. He called up a number thinking it to be of customer care. The fraudster made him download an application. The victim also shared a nine-digit code with the fraudster.

344.title: Musk starts poll on whether to reinstate Trump, says 'Voice of people is voice of God'
344.article_body: Elon Musk on Friday started a Twitter poll asking users whether the former President Donald Trump should be reinstated on the platform. He followed up his tweet with the Latin phrase, "Vox Populi, Vox Dei," which translates to, "The voice of the people is the voice of God." Twitter permanently suspended Trump after the US Capitol riots in January 2021.

345.title: Kim Jong-un's daughter seen in public for 1st time at N Korea's ballistic missile test
345.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's daughter was seen in public for the first time on Friday in photos shared by state news agency KCNA. The photos showed the leader and his daughter hand-in-hand inspecting the launch of the country's largest ballistic missile. Kim has three children with his wife Ri Sol Ju, as per South Korea's National Intelligence Service.

346.title: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes sentenced to 11 years in jail for fraud
346.article_body: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes was sentenced to 11 years and three months in prison by a California judge on Friday for defrauding investors in her now-defunct blood testing startup. The 38-year-old Stanford dropout was sentenced on three counts of investor fraud and one count of conspiracy. Theranos was once valued at $9 billion, before its collapse in 2018.

347.title: Twitter's crypto head quits as part of mass exit of staff at firm
347.article_body: Twitter's crypto development team head Tess Rinearson has quit the firm as part of employees' mass exit after Twitter's new owner Elon Musk asked the employees to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture. Rinearson posted a tweet with the salute emoji, followed by a blue heart. Senior software engineer of the crypto unit Hamdi Allam has also left the firm.

348.title: Berkshire warns investors about crypto website using its name
348.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway warned investors on Friday that it has no affiliation with a purported crypto brokerage website, berkshirehathawaytx.com. "The entity who has this web address has no affiliation with Berkshire Hathaway...or its Chairman...Warren E Buffett," Berkshire said.
