The website includes purported customer testimonials and describes its operator as a Texas-based broker founded in 2020.

349.title: Novak Djokovic defeats Daniil Medvedev to stay unbeaten in ATP Finals
349.article_body: World number eight Novak Djokovic stayed unbeaten in the round-robin stage of the ATP Finals by defeating world number five, Russia's Daniil Medvedev, 6-3, 6-7(7-5), 7-6(7-2) at the Pala Alpitour in Turin on Friday. With this, Djokovic topped the Red Group. Djokovic will face Taylor Fritz in the semi-final on Saturday.

350.title: Girls forced into prostitution in numerous Rajasthan districts: NCW
350.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) said it has evidence of young girls being forced into prostitution in "numerous districts" of Rajasthan like Sawai Madhopur, Bhilwara and Bharatpur. The NCW said people were hiding the "true extent" of the crime "due to threats from the panchayat and local government". The commission has asked for an SIT probe from the Centre.

351.title: Canadian man arrested for alleged plot to overthrow Haitian govt
351.article_body: Canadian police have arrested a 51-year-old man from Quebec for allegedly planning "a terrorist act to overthrow the Haitian government of (former President) Jovenel Moise". The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said the arrest was made after an investigation that started last year. The accused planned "to stage an armed revolution" and ultimately wanted to "seize power", the RCMP said.

352.title: Northern Ireland police vehicle damaged in suspected bomb attack
352.article_body: A homemade bomb has damaged a police vehicle in Strabane, Northern Ireland, officials said, adding that the incident "appears to have been a targeted attack on police". The attack, which occurred on Thursday, is believed to have been caused by an improvised explosive device, police said. Two officers, who were in the vehicle at the time, have escaped without injury.

353.title: Beijing district records spike in COVID-19 cases
353.article_body: Officials in the Chinese capital Beijing's biggest district, Chaoyang, have advised residents to stay at home this weekend due to a spike in COVID-19 cases. Chaoyang on Thursday reported 466 cases. The advice comes as China is easing its COVID-19-related restrictions policy. Now, restrictions are being enforced in specific outbreak zones. Capacity limits at entertainment venues were also scrapped.

354.title: Karnataka govt removes restrictions on sandalwood farming: Report
354.article_body: The Karnataka Government has reportedly removed all restrictions on growing and marketing sandalwood in the state. "There is a huge demand...in national and international markets...this will encourage farmers," said Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar. To protect farmers from smugglers, the state will reportedly install a microchip in the trees to alert officials when someone tries to cut them.

355.title: Terror financing more dangerous than terrorism itself: Amit Shah
355.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said terror financing is more dangerous than terrorism itself. "The transformation of terrorism from 'dynamite to metaverse' and 'AK-47 to virtual assets' is definitely a matter of concern," said Shah. He added that there is an increase in the use of "virtual assets like cryptocurrency" and there is a need to understand "patterns" of darknet activities.

356.title: Death toll from gas tank explosion in northern Iraq rises to 15
356.article_body: The death toll from an explosion caused by a heating gas tank in a residential complex in northern Iraq has risen to 15, a civil defence official said on Friday. There are no more bodies buried under the rubble, he added. The explosion on Thursday in the city of Sulaymaniyah destroyed three houses and injured 16 people, as per authorities.

357.title: 140 inmates of Dasna Jail in Ghaziabad diagnosed with HIV: Official
357.article_body: As many as 140 inmates of Dasna District Jail in Ghaziabad have been diagnosed with HIV, said District Jail Superintendent Alok Kumar Singh on Friday. As per the rules, all prisoners are tested for HIV before they are lodged in jail. "An average of 120 to 150 HIV-positive inmates are living in the jail since 2016," Singh said.

358.title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends transfer of 3 HC judges: Report
358.article_body: The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended transferring three high court (HC) judges for administrative reasons, PTI reported on Friday. Madras High Court's Acting Chief Justice T Raja was recommended for transfer to the Rajasthan High Court. Justice Nikhil S Kariel (Gujarat High Court) and Justice A Abhishek Reddy (Telangana High Court) were recommended for transfer to the Patna High Court.

359.title: Japanese journalist freed by Myanmar junta returns home
359.article_body: A 26-year-old Japanese filmmaker and video journalist who was sentenced to 10 years in prison by Myanmar's military junta after being arrested in July, returned to Japan on Friday. Toru Kubota and three other foreign prisoners were released as part of a broad prisoner amnesty under which the junta also freed many local citizens held for protesting the army takeover.

360.title: Football commentator kisses Ukrainian player's foot in the name of Kerala, criticised
360.article_body: Malayalam football commentator Shaiju Damodaran kissed the foot of Kerala Blasters' Ukrainian footballer Ivan Kaliuzhnyi for a YouTube video after the latter scored a goal against FC Goa. Damodaran said that the kiss was in the name of entire Kerala. Criticising him, a user said, "I'm a fan of you and Kerala Blasters...but I don't belong to...Kerala which you mentioned."

361.title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.7 strikes southwest of Indonesia’s Sumatra
361.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.7 struck southwest of Sumatra, Indonesia on Friday, the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said. The quake was at a depth of 10 km (6.21 miles), the EMSC added. There was no tsunami threat due to the earthquake. Further, no injuries or loss of property has been reported so far.

362.title: Tesla recalls around 30,000 Model X cars over front passenger airbag issue
362.article_body: Tesla has recalled nearly 30,000 Model X cars over an issue that may cause the front passenger airbag to deploy incorrectly, according to a company letter filed with US NHTSA. The problem will be fixed through an over-the-air software update, the company said. Earlier this month, Tesla recalled over 40,000 Model S and Model X vehicles over steering issue.

363.title: US-based used car retailer Carvana lays off 1,500 employees
363.article_body: US-based used car retailer Carvana is laying off around 1,500 people, or 8% of its workforce, CNBC reported citing an internal message. The email from CEO Ernie Garcia cited economic headwinds including higher financing costs and delayed car purchasing. He added the company "failed to accurately predict how this would all play out and...impact it would have on our business".

364.title: Will install Savarkar's statue in front of Cong HQ: Hindu Mahasabha
364.article_body: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha President Swami Chakrapani on Friday said that the party will install a statue of freedom fighter Veer Savarkar in front of Congress headquarters at Akbar Road in Delhi. He also asked PM Narendra Modi to rename Akbar Road as Veer Savarkar Road. This comes after Congress MP Rahul Gandhi claimed that Savarkar had helped British rulers.

365.title: All SC benches to take up 10 transfer pleas daily: CJI Chandrachud
365.article_body: All Supreme Court (SC) benches should take up 10 bail applications and 10 transfer petitions every day, said Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud on Friday. The CJI said that this decision was taken at a full-court meeting. He said there are about 3,000 transfer petitions pending and these will be decided before the winter break.

366.title: Simon Doull shares pic of seats at Wellington ground, says 'What a shambles of a place'
366.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull took to Twitter to criticise facilities at Sky Stadium in Wellington where the first T20I between India and New Zealand was abandoned due to rain today. He shared pictures of seats in commentary area and wrote, "I've just cleaned all...seats...so our overseas guests can sit down. What a shambles of a place. Embarrassing."

367.title: Activist projects 'Elon Musk: Space Karen, Mediocre Manchild' on Twitter HQ
367.article_body: An activist projected a message calling Twitter owner Elon Musk 'Space Karen, Mediocre Manchild, Petulant Pimple, Bankruptcy Baby' on Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco. A video of the projected ticker has surfaced online. This came amid reports of a mass exodus of employees from the company after Musk told employees to be "extremely hardcore" or leave Twitter.

368.title: Shouldn't see some faces again in next T20 World Cup: Sehwag
368.article_body: Virender Sehwag said he wants some changes in the Indian team for T20 World Cup 2024. "I don't want changes in...thinking process or anything else...In the next World Cup, you shouldn't see some faces again," he stated. "You have two years to examine and there are some senior players whose performances are not up to the mark," Sehwag added.

369.title: Looking forward to seeing how Hardik leads India in T20Is vs NZ: Shastri
369.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said he's looking forward to seeing the way skipper Hardik Pandya leads Team India in T20I series against New Zealand. "He has got the flamboyance...the exuberance. That will reflect on the players in the team," he added. The first T20I of the three-match series was abandoned due to rain in Wellington on Friday.

370.title: 4-yr-old Kerala boy mauled by pack of stray dogs, sustains 40 wounds
370.article_body: A four-year-old boy suffered critical injuries after a pack of stray dogs mauled him in Kerala's Tanalur on Friday. The child, identified as Mohammed Riswan, sustained over 40 wounds all over his body, including the head. He is currently undergoing treatment at a government hospital in Kozhikode. The incident took place when Riswan was standing near his house.

371.title: Manchester United to sue Cristiano Ronaldo and ban him from club: Reports
371.article_body: Manchester United have appointed lawyers to sue Cristiano Ronaldo for alleged breach of contract after claims made by him in an interview, as per reports. The 37-year-old has reportedly been instructed not to return to the club's Carrington training base after his participation with Portugal in World Cup. In the interview, Ronaldo had spoken against the club owners and manager.

372.title: It was probably the best I've felt in about 6 years: Steve Smith on 80* vs England
372.article_body: Talking about his 80*(78) against England in first ODI, Australia batter Steve Smith said, "It was probably the best I've felt in about six years." "I was just in really nice positions and I felt really good...I honestly haven't felt that way in six years," he added. During the innings, Smith was heard telling David Warner, "I am back, baby."

373.title: It didn't need to be like this: Gary Neville on Ronaldo's interview
373.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Gary Neville said a "mature conversation" between Cristiano Ronaldo and the club could have averted the situation that led to the forward's interview. "Sad that...arguably United's greatest-ever talent is likely to be sacked," said Neville. He added that "it didn't need to be like this" and Ronaldo could have "secured a smooth exit".

374.title: Chopped hand found at cemetery in Bihar's Darbhanga district
374.article_body: A severed human hand was found at a cemetery in Bihar's Darbhanga district on Friday, police informed. The hand was first found on the cemetery ground on Wednesday, following which locals buried it in the ground. However, they informed the police about the matter after a stench filled the area. Police reached there and took the hand in their possession.

375.title: They didn't sulk: Karthik on Chahal, Harshal not playing a single match in T20 WC 2022
375.article_body: Talking about Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel not getting a single game in T20 World Cup 2022, Dinesh Karthik said, "They did not sulk, they were not upset." He added, "At the start of the tournament, they were told that under these certain conditions we will be playing you, otherwise it will be hard for us. So, they were aware."

376.title: Uruguay, Argentina carry combined 900-kg meat to Qatar for FIFA World Cup
376.article_body: Uruguay and Argentina have carried a combined over 900 kg of meat to Qatar for FIFA World Cup 2022. "The Uruguayan Football Association is a historic ambassador of our country and will take with it another ambassador, which is Uruguayan meat, the best meat in the world," the association's president Ignacio Alonso said. The World Cup will begin on Sunday.

377.title: No truth to it: Adani Group on reports of Adani planning to open family office overseas
377.article_body: After reports claimed that Gautam Adani is planning to open a family office in Dubai or New York, Adani Group issued a clarification. "There is no truth to this claim. Neither Mr Adani nor the Adani Family has any plan or is in consultations to open a family office overseas," the group said in a statement.

378.title: Nico Hulkenberg replaces Mick Schumacher at Haas F1 for 2023 season
378.article_body: Nico Hulkenberg will replace fellow German Mick Schumacher at Haas F1 for the 2023 season. The 35-year-old has previously driven for Williams, Force India, Sauber, Renault, as well as Aston Martin, and will partner with Kevin Magnussen. Mick, son of the seven-time world champion Michael Schumacher, lost his Haas seat after two years due to poor results and multiple accidents.

379.title: Best news possible: Nadal on Djokovic being granted visa to play in Aus Open
379.article_body: Commenting on unvaccinated Novak Djokovic being granted a visa to play in Australian Open 2023, Rafael Nadal said, "That's the best news possible, especially knowing that now the virus is more under control, seems, around the world. So why not?" Djokovic was deported from Australia in January 2022 and handed a three-year visa ban due to his COVID-19 vaccination status.

380.title: Only 14% of POCSO cases lead to convictions: Report
380.article_body: Only 14.03% of cases under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act lead to convictions, an independent think-tank has reported. The report was prepared by the Vidhi Centre for Legal Policy in collaboration with the Data Evidence for Justice Reform programme of the World Bank. The report analysed cases under the POCSO Act in eCourts across the country.

381.title: Hera Pheri without Akshay Kumar is unthinkable: Gulshan Grover
381.article_body: Actor Gulshan Grover, reacting to Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3', said, "I have to say Hera Pheri without Akshay is unthinkable." He added that the film is identified with its characters. "So it'll be fantastic to see them back because these characters have remained in...minds of audiences," Gulshan, who was a part of the first film, further said.

382.title: More than 10 Russian POWs executed by Ukraine: Russia
382.article_body: Russia said on Friday that Ukraine had executed more than 10 Russian prisoners of war (POWs) with "direct shots to the head". Russia's Defence Ministry made the claim while confirming the veracity of a video claiming to show the execution of Russian POWs. "This...murder of Russian servicemen is neither the first nor the only war crime [by Ukraine]," it said.

383.title: Avalanche kills three Indian Army jawans near LoC in J&K
383.article_body: Three soldiers of Indian Army's 56 Rashtriya Rifles achieved martyrdom on Friday after being hit by an avalanche near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara. Police said the bodies of the jawans, who died in the line of duty, have been recovered. The deceased have been identified as Souvik Hajra, Mukesh Kumar and Gaikwad Manoj Laxman Rao.

384.title: Committed to working quickly on UK-India FTA: UK PM Sunak
384.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said that the UK government remains committed to working "as quickly as possible" towards a successful conclusion to the ongoing free trade agreement (FTA) talks with India. He reiterated that he would not "sacrifice quality for speed" after he was questioned over FTA missing its Diwali deadline.

385.title: Missile capable of targeting entire US test-fired by North Korea, says Japan
385.article_body: North Korea has test-fired an Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) that has a range of over 15,000 kilometres, Japanese Defence Minister Yasukazu Hamada has said. The range is enough to cover the entire mainland United States, Hamada said. The missile was launched in the second major weapons test this month and landed near Japanese waters on Friday.

386.title: Vicky calls Katrina Kaif a 'scientist', says 'She has a lot of knowledge'
386.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal during an event described his actress-wife Katrina Kaif as a "scientist" and said, "She has a lot of knowledge." "But she helps me a lot and is always making sure I am eating well, taking care of myself, sleeping well, and not just running around to work," he added. Vicky and Katrina tied the knot in 2021.

387.title: Proud: Rijiju on Manika becoming 1st Indian woman to reach Asian Cup semis
387.article_body: Reacting to table tennis player Manika Batra becoming the first Indian woman to reach the semi-final of Asian Cup, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju took to Twitter and wrote, "Proud of Manika Batra." The 27-year-old defeated Chinese Taipei's Chen Szu-Yu 6-11, 11-6, 11-5, 11-7, 8-11, 9-11, 11-9 in the quarter-final on Friday. Manika will face Japan's Mima Ito on Saturday.

388.title: Haven't watched it, so I'm ok with it: Bruno on Ronaldo's interview
388.article_body: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes said he has not watched fellow Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo's interview so he's "ok with" it. Fernandes said the Portuguese team is currently concentrating on the FIFA World Cup as it "doesn't come around many times". He added that the handshake video of the duo that went viral was actually of Cristiano joking with him.

389.title: FM Sitharaman to begin pre-budget meet with stakeholders from Nov 21
389.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will start the customary pre-budget meetings with stakeholders from November 21, with a special emphasis on climate change and infrastructure-related issues. She would meet representatives from agriculture industry and financial sector on November 22. Meetings with the trade union representatives and economists are scheduled for November 28.

390.title: My role in New Zealand team is to be aggressive bowler: Ish Sodhi
390.article_body: New Zealand leg-spinner Ish Sodhi said that his role in the side is to be an aggressive bowler. "I am all for aggressive bowlers in attacks. Blessed to have bowlers who can bowl 150 kmph like Adam Milne and Lockie Ferguson. Mitchell Santner is economical on the other end," Sodhi said. He added that leg-spinners are an "important weapon".

391.title: Ronaldo finding it difficult to accept that he’s getting old: Rooney
391.article_body: Former Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has responded to Cristiano Ronaldo's criticism and said the Portuguese star is finding it hard to deal with the fact that he's ageing. "Some of the comments, they're strange, but I'm sure Manchester United will deal with it," said Rooney. Ronaldo had said that Rooney criticised him because the English footballer's career is "finished".

392.title: Mamata a respected CM, will work with her objectively: Governor-designate
392.article_body: The newly appointed West Bengal Governor Dr CV Ananda Bose said that he sees Mamata Banerjee as a respected CM. "I've an open mind and will work with her with objectivity," Bose said, adding that West Bengal is a great state. "If Governor and CM keep themselves well within the confines of the Constitution, there'll be no difficulty," he added.

393.title: Rahul Gandhi only mentioned facts about VD Savarkar: Jairam Ramesh
393.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh defended Rahul Gandhi saying that he did not target VD Savarkar but only highlighted a "historical fact". "Gandhi had mentioned...how tribal leader Birsa Munda did not compromise with the British while Savarkar signed a mercy petition," claimed Ramesh. He added that Rahul's statement will have no bearing on the MVA alliance with Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena.

394.title: Punjab govt approves reimplementation of Old Pension Scheme
394.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Friday announced that the state Cabinet has approved the reimplementation of the Old Pension Scheme. The state government said the scheme will directly benefit more than 1.75 lakh government employees. The scheme, under which the entire pension amount was given by the government, was discontinued in India from April 1, 2004.

395.title: Jofra Archer likely to return to cricket in early 2023: Reports
395.article_body: After being out since July 2021 owing to an injury, England pacer Jofra Archer is reportedly expected to return to cricket in early 2023. "He (Archer) is currently in the UAE with the England Lions team and is continuing his rehab. He is making excellent progress," an ECB spokesman told Cricbuzz. Notably, Archer has been retained by Mumbai Indians.

396.title: Just to seek attention: Fadnavis on Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Savarkar
396.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his remarks on Veer Savarkar during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and claimed the remarks were just to seek attention. "He should speak within the legal framework. If he violates that, we will have to take action," Fadnavis said. Rahul Gandhi on Thursday claimed that Savarkar helped the British.

397.title: Farhan Akhtar shares video of daughter Akira singing on stage, pens note
397.article_body: Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram to share a video of his daughter Akira. In the video, she could be seen singing Tori Kelly's 'Don't You Worry 'Bout A Thing'. "You've come a long way @akiraakhtar, keep going. The world is your oyster. Shout out to...incredible band on stage," he wrote. Reacting to the video, Shibani Dandekar wrote, "What a star."

398.title: SC rejects NIA plea, orders Navlakha to be placed under house arrest
398.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday dismissed the National Investigation Agency's (NIA) plea seeking a recall of activist Gautam Navlakha's house arrest order. The SC said Navlakha should be placed under house arrest within 24 hours. Navlakha is lodged in Taloja jail in Mumbai in connection with the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case.

399.title: Gold worth ₹38 lakh seized by customs dept at Kochi airport
399.article_body: The customs department's Air Intelligence Unit seized around 422 grams of gold worth over ₹38 lakh at the Kochi airport on Friday. The gold was allegedly brought in rings and in the form of paste inside the underwear, the customs officials said. They added that a special pocket was made in the underwear and gold was sewn inside of that.

400.title: 800 kg of poppy seized in J&K's Udhampur, 2 drug peddlers held
400.article_body: Police on Friday recovered 800 kg of poppy in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district and arrested two drug peddlers, officials said. A police team conducting routine checks on the Jammu-Srinagar national highway intercepted an oil tanker at Jakhani, officials added. A case has been registered against the accused, identified as Gorav and Naseeb, who hail from Sonipat.

401.title: BCCI sacks Chetan Sharma-led senior national selection committee
401.article_body: The BCCI today sacked the four-member senior national selection committee led by Chetan Sharma after India failed to reach T20 World Cup 2022 final. During Chetan's stint, India also failed to reach knockout stage of T20 World Cup 2021 and lost World Test Championship 2021 final. Harvinder Singh, Sunil Joshi and Debashish Mohanty were the other members in the committee.
